programme.title: Attenborough's Life in Colour
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals the extraordinary ways that some animals use colour to hide and disappear into the background. The Bengal tigers of central India use their striped patterns to dazzle colour blind prey, while zebras on the Masai Mara use motion dazzle to confuse predators. Other animals use colour to trick and to deceive. On Australia's Great Barrier Reef, a blue-striped blenny uses colours to mimic other fish and launch a sudden attack.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Catchpoint
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness hosts the family-friendly game show combining physical fun and an exciting question mechanic, as contestants have to think fast as they answer questions while trying to catch balls of various sizes dropped from the studio ceiling, with a variety of entertaining rounds and a cash prize at stake.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Bank Balance for Red Nose Day
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo and his son Luci compete in this special edition of the game show, stacking the gold bars on the balance board in a bid to win up to £100,000 for charity. But if they have answered incorrectly, the bars they stack will amount to nothing - and only serve to add further weight to the already precarious board, which could collapse at any second and leave them with nothing.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Married couple Sam and Louise from Aberdeen take on The Wall, hoping to combine knowledge, strategy and luck for the chance to win life-changing prizes. Will they get the questions right? And can they walk away with cash to buy a bigger house for when they can start a family? Hosted by Danny Dyer.

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Taking part are Gok Wan, Brian Conley, Richard McCourt, Dominic Wood, Libby Clegg, Stef Reid, Stephen K Amos and Zoe Lyons.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Faith realises her marriage is unsalvageable and falls into Dylan's arms, while Fenisha struggles with admitting her horrifying fears about Bodhi. Connie shows an eager Grace some of the trauma equipment that is used in the ED, and Grace is inspired by her mother's profession. Connie works a hectic shift and feels guilty for neglecting her daughter yet again, but the youngster is unphased and understanding, buoyed by a newfound interest in medicine.

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: AC-12's investigation exposes a vicious criminal gang run from within the police, and Dryden is charged with conspiracy to pervert the course of justice. While Arnott now appears convinced of Denton's innocence, Fleming remains determined to prove she had a role in the ambush. Crime thriller, starring Keeley Hawes, Martin Compston and Vicky McClure. Last in the series.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Leeds United v Chelsea at Elland Road. The Citizens will have been expecting to maintain their excellent form at the expense of struggling Fulham, while the Blues will have hoped to emulate their 3-1 win over Leeds at Stamford Bridge in December. Plus, Crystal Palace v West Bromwich Albion and Everton v Burnley.

programme.title: Eagle Eye
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Shia LaBeouf, Michelle Monaghan and Billy Bob Thornton. Two strangers are coerced into following the instructions of a mysterious phone caller, becoming fugitives from the law in the process.

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman hosts as the remaining three contestants take part in the final as they compete to be crowned the first-ever winner of the competition, with the cooks having to impress Mary Berry, Angela Hartnett and Chris Bavin if they're to win the title. First, the competitors take on the Rustle Up challenge, creating dishes that showcase butternut squash as the main ingredient, before being asked to produce their ultimate picnic and presenting their creations to the judges at a beautifully decorated picnic tables. Who will be crowned the winner? Last in the series.

programme.title: Being Bridget Jones
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating 25 years of Helen Fielding's hapless creation. The programme examines the ways in which society's attitudes to women have shifted in 25 years, along with the ways in which female writers have told their own stories since Bridget made her debut. Featuring interviews with Helen Fielding, and the friends she based the original characters on, as well as tributes from celebrity fans.

programme.title: Sailing
programme.desc: Live coverage from Auckland, as defending champions Emirates Team New Zealand take on Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon and his team travel to rural Oxfordshire to meet Asiyla and her family and help transform an old sailing boat into unique glamping accommodation.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah showcases a selection of Cotswolds properties to a couple from Essex who are hoping their budget of £550,000 will buy them a new home with three bedrooms, one of which could be used for a home office. The presenter also visits a quarry from which Cotswold stone is used for new builds and conservation projects.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Windermere Jetty Museum in the Lake District, where items assessed include a collection of silver trophies awarded to a pioneering female sailor. There is also a James Bond poster scraped off a wall, a guitar rescued from a skip, a wooden dingy from the film Swallows & Amazons, and a pair of necklaces with surprising values.

programme.title: Workout the Wright Way
programme.desc: For today's exercises, Mark Wright is joined by Strictly and reality TV star Jamie Laing. Last in the series.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily 11-12 Years: Music In Me
programme.desc: Energy stores in physics, guiding the reader in English, and finding inspiration within ourselves in music. Last in the series.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily 12-13 Years: Leitmotifs in Music
programme.desc: The science of sound waves and leitmotifs in music. Last in the series.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily 13-14 Years: Writing Song Lyrics
programme.desc: Magnetic fields in science and writing song lyrics in music. Last in the series.

programme.title: Further Back in Time for Dinner
programme.desc: The family reflect on their time travels, discovering that much of what they experienced in the past, still lives on around our dinner tables today. Polly Russell shows them the delights of a contemporary canned meal, and Brandon and Rochelle sample a Peruvian dinner with co-presenter Giles Coren. Finally the Robshaws share a celebratory meal with Giles and Polly as they realise how many of our historical eating habits are still a treasured part of modern family mealtimes. Last in the series.

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Chuko Ojiri hopes a wooden beetle will fly at the auction, while a job lot of broken crockery threatens disaster for Eric Knowles in the week's finale.

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Eric Knowles takes on Danny Sebastian at an antiques fair in Nottinghamshire, with the two taking very different approaches to buying and selling.

programme.title: Best House in Town
programme.desc: In York, the winners of the best detached, best apartment, best semi-detached and best wildcard property are revisited by the judges for a second inspection. The arbiters must make their ultimate decision and crown only one of them the week's Best House in Town.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antiques experts Claire Rawle and Thomas Plant look out for potential treasures at Chiddingstone Castle in Kent, while presenter Paul Martin visits a hop garden and hears about the thousands of Londoners who descended on farms to pick the hops in times gone by.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mina Anwar, Glenn Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson keep their eyes on the prize as Richard Osman reveals who is the week's winner. Last in the series.

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: In the Cotswolds, Simon Parfett and his team meet Tammy and Colin. Wanting to spend more time together as a family and create extra income, they decided to buy a horsebox which they could rent out to festival-goers. Alas, things didn't go to plan, so Simon and company come to the rescue.

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Reece Parkinson and the team take an offbeat look at the Premier League, also discussing skills, celebrities, fashion, music and culture.

programme.title: River Walks: The Hodder
programme.desc: Broadcaster and rambler Stuart Maconie walks along the River Hodder in the Forest of Bowland, enjoying the scenery and examining intriguing myths and snippets of history.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don and the team look back at more floral highlights from 2020, including alliums and auriculas, houseplants and creative containers, as well as the scented stars of the summer garden. There's also another chance to see what the Gardeners' World viewers were getting up to in their gardens last year as they share their horticultural adventures.

programme.title: The Comedy Vaults: BBC2's Hidden Treasure
programme.desc: As part of the channel's 50th birthday celebrations, this programme delves into the archives for rarely seen moments from some of the greatest names in comedy. Featuring clips from unbroadcast pilots including Miranda Hart's Joke Shop, Stephen Fry's first appearance as QI host and a sitcom starring the band Madness, as well as footage of Spike Milligan, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore, Rik Mayall, Billy Connolly, and Sacha Baron Cohen. Tamsin Greig narrates.

programme.title: Later - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The host chats to award-winning British songstress Laura Mvula, who discusses her favourite performances from the Later archive. Plus, South London four-piece Dry Cleaning make their TV debut. And singer/songwriter Paul Weller performs a track from his new LP, Fat Pop (Volume 1) at his Black Barn studios in Surrey.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Weather bulletin.

programme.title: Festival of Funny: Shorts
programme.desc: A bold, contemporary collection of the silliest, most distinctive comedy short films. Platforming the next generation of comedy voices, the films showcase the most exciting creative talent from all across the UK and beyond.

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: Tyrol seeks advice from the imprisoned Baltar after clashing with Admiral Adama over the need for safer working conditions on board the ship, and Seelix becomes involved in the argument after being turned down for flight training.

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: Starbuck's mental stability causes concern with Admiral Adama and Lee as she struggles to come to terms with her time spent in captivity on New Caprica.

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and the team are in rural Wiltshire to help Tom and Jen turn their old family caravan into a unique and profitable short-term rental accommodation.

programme.title: Miss World 1970: Beauty Queens and Bedlam
programme.desc: The story of the protest at the contest, when protestors dramatically disrupted the event and kickstarted a feminist revolution in front of an audience of millions. Hannah Berryman's film uses archive, animation and contributions from key players to offer an entertaining and thought-provoking celebration of a night of game-changing anarchy.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Marrying Mum and Dad
programme.desc: Best friends Tom and Alfie attempt to bring the Australian Outback to the West Midlands, complete with a bug-eating competition and an upside-down set.

programme.title: The Dengineers: Christmas Den: Christmas Den
programme.desc: A nine-year-old who lives in one of the UK's most famous summer hotspots longs for a Christmas-themed den where she can celebrate her favourite season all year round.

programme.title: Blue Peter: Gold Badge Awards: Junior Bake Off Winner Live!
programme.desc: Junior Bake Off winner Reece makes a Mother's Day treat.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall heads to Norway to dive with the orca.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall witnesses a serval hunting in South Africa.

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Pirate Fairy
programme.desc: Animated fantasy adventure, featuring the voices of Mae Whitman, Christina Hendricks and Tom Hiddleston. TinkerBell's tearaway friend Zarina gets into trouble after experimenting with blue pixie dust. She flees, taking more of the substance with her, so TinkerBell and her friends are forced to give chase.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don brings his globe-trotting botanical tour to a close with a visit to South-east Asia, where he hopes to witness a true tropical oasis. Visiting the immaculately presented garden of Jim Thompson House in Bangkok, he discovers an exotic plot with a Western flavour. He also meets former president Lee Kuan Yew, who once stated that Singapore should be `a city in a garden'. Last in the series.

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The presenter introduces animals that build structures and adapt the environment for their own benefit, creating safe places to sleep and raise young or traps to catch prey. The programme examines how the huge dams built by beavers can completely transform the surrounding landscape, the function of the different types of silk spiders are capable of producing, and how leafcutter ants build underground gardens where they farm their own food.

programme.title: The Chronicles of Nadiya
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following Great British Bake Off winner Nadiya Hussain as she takes a food-inspired journey and returns to her roots in Bangladesh. In the first edition, she travels to her family village near Sylhet in the north east of the country, where she shares her favourite recipes, including baked fish with green mango chutney and thoosha shinni. For a relative's wedding, she bakes a three-tiered pumpkin celebration cake for the bride, and she also takes the opportunity to reconnect with family she has not seen since her arranged marriage over ten years ago.

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw makes over Susan and Brian Duthie's new-build garden in Cove, Aberdeenshire, transforming their tiny site from the nightmare of rough builder's rubble.

programme.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
programme.desc: Mandy and Chris adore their Victorian home in Manchester, but they cannot unlock the potential of their garden. Overlooked on all sides, the couple feel exposed whenever they spend time in it. Providing inspiration for the area are designers Helen Elks-Smith and Pip Probert. Meanwhile, Joel Bird meets Ben and Elaine, a Wiltshire couple who have an unusual outdoor space. Angela Scanlon hosts.

programme.title: Up Periscope
programme.desc: Second World War drama starring James Garner. Tensions are high and personal conflicts threaten to explode when an underwater demolition officer is seconded to the USS Barracuda for an important mission.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley helps people answer life-changing questions by examining their DNA. This time, Stacy meets 31-year-old Duri, who fears she may carry a potentially fatal genetic mutation and wants to test her DNA to see if she could suffer from the same disease as her mother. Elsewhere, a woman who was adopted when she was just six-months-old wants to use DNA technology to finally uncover information about her ancestry.

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: As they fight to secure a place in the semi-finals, the four remaining designers are challenged to transform two hair salons in Richmond, London, and for the first time in the competition, the designers will see their spaces before creating their visions. Presenter Alan Carr and judge Michelle Ogundehin will then decide who makes it through to the next stage.

programme.title: The 80s with Dominic Sandbrook
programme.desc: Historian Dominic Sandbrook follows up his 2012 documentary series The 70s by moving on to the following decade. He begins by examining how powerful new forces of choice and consumerism radically reshaped British life - a new culture of consumer-driven populism that propelled Margaret Thatcher to victory. He takes in everything from the popularity of Delia Smith and affordable fashions on the high street, to the subcultures of Britain's youth and the crisis of identity that rocked and splintered the political left.

programme.title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1980
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the music show's evolution, and the dramatic changes that took place in 1980 when a new generation of British pop arrived, leading to the veteran Top of the Pops orchestra being laid off, and the studio audience doubling in size. Featuring Adam Ant, the Human League, OMD, Kevin Rowland, Sally Lindsay, Kelly Marie, Ray Dorset, Johnny Logan, the Vapors, the Piranhas, and Richard Skinner.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Jack Carroll and Olga Koch join regular Alan Davies as Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the quiz with a difference, asking questions on the theme of rogue.

programme.title: Billie: In Search of Billie Holiday
programme.desc: A profile of the American jazz singer, capturing her depths and complexity through interviews conducted by journalist Linda Lipnack Kuehl with those who knew her best. With contributions by Charles Mingus, Tony Bennett, Sylvia Syms and Count Basie, as well as her cousin, schoolfriends, lovers, lawyers, pimps and even the FBI agents who arrested her.

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: Music drama starring Miles Teller and J K Simmons. Aspiring jazz drummer Andrew wins a place at a prestigious music conservatory and quickly advances to the school's studio band. But the educational approach of instructor Terence Fletcher consists of intimidating and threatening his students. With Andrew determined to succeed, and Fletcher obsessed with musical perfection, an unpredictable battle of wills unfolds.

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: Continuing the third series of Robert Popper's award-winning comedy about the Goodmans' Friday night gatherings. The family is distraught when Grandma gets engaged to Mr Morris, her horrible 85-year-old boyfriend who upset everyone and lost his temper the first time he came for dinner in 2012. Dad couldn't stand him back then and hid in his shed, but will they get along this time? Meanwhile, Jim collects money for charity dressed in a dog costume that doesn't leave out any detail. Starring Simon Bird, Tom Rosenthal, Tamsin Greig, Paul Ritter and Mark Heap, with Frances Cuka and Harry Landis.

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: Dad paints a portrait of Mum that resembles Margaret Thatcher, putting a damper on their anniversary celebrations, while Jonny gets a tattoo of a skull and Jim goes sleepwalking around the house - causing havoc. Comedy, starring Simon Bird, Paul Ritter, Tamsin Greig, Tom Rosenthal and Mark Heap.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he heads for West Babylon, New York, where he helped the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts, before returning to Davide in Boston, an Italian restaurant run by two warring brothers. Finally, he visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island, run by hot-headed owner Abby.

programme.title: Ramy
programme.desc: Dena starts to explore her sexuality, and keen to lose her virginity takes a shine to barista-artist Kyle. They hook up one night, but the evening doesn't pan out quite as she'd have liked. Comedy drama, starring Ramy Youssef and May Calamawy.

programme.title: The Great
programme.desc: Catherine moves forward with the coup, and realises the only chance for a greater Russia is to fight, no matter the sacrifices. Comedy drama, starring Elle Fanning and Nicholas Hoult. Last in the series.

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Nikki finds herself struggling to survive as she cheats death in the company of an unlikely ally. Sy goes to visit Emmit, where he is receives an uncomfortable welcome instead from Varga. Gloria is surprised by a visitor as she prepares to leave. Ewan McGregor, Carrie Coon, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and David Thewlis star.

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz, in which 15 contestants are pitted against one another in the hope of securing a place in the end-of-series final when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.

programme.title: Jamie: Keep Cooking and Carry On
programme.desc: Host Jamie Oliver shows an easy method for home-made pasta shapes and shares one of the Olivers' favourite pasta sauces, as well as recipes for super-food chicken fajitas and a one-pan sausage and apple bake.

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits the Great Yorkshire Show, where she takes on the challenge of creating a cushion using various forms of needlecraft, including machine embroidery, patchwork quilting and applique.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer presides as the very best players return to compete for the title Champion of Champions, under the watchful eyes of resident experts Susie Dent and Rachel Riley, with guest Linda Papadopoulos in Dictionary Corner.

programme.title: Mike & Molly
programme.desc: Two days before their wedding, Mike and Molly participate in a rehearsal - but it ends in disaster. Comedy, starring Billy Gardell and Melissa McCarthy.

programme.title: Mike & Molly
programme.desc: The couple's big day finally arrives, but they face a series of problems before the ceremony begins. Comedy, starring Billy Gardell and Melissa McCarthy.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam's reputation is tested by Henri's challenge to decide who is the more accomplished ladies' man, and the battle to collect the most telephone numbers turns into an international contest between America and France.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: An old flame of Cliff's makes a dramatic return to the bar, claiming to be pregnant with his child, and Rebecca recruits a jingle writer to improve business. Featuring an appearance by John Mahoney, later one of the stars of spin-off Frasier.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug decorates the house for Halloween against Arthur's wishes - and then regrets it when the old man has a heart attack. Meanwhile, Deacon wants to buy a comic-book character costume for his son, but is frustrated to find there aren't any black superheroes. Comedy, starring Kevin James.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Arthur is admitted to hospital for heart surgery and while leafing through an extensive scrapbook Carrie discovers her father's hidden secrets. Meanwhile, Doug soon regrets makes friends with a quirky stranger in the wards. Comedy, starring Jerry Stiller and Leah Remini.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Daphne prepares to tie the knot with Donny, her family arrives for the wedding of the year and Niles struggles with his feelings for her.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part one of two. Niles and Daphne run out on their weddings, prompting Donny to issue a lawsuit and Mel to plot revenge. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce, Jane Leeves and Saul Rubinek.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steven Newman, CEO of department store chain Loehmann's, views his company from a different perspective when he goes undercover as an aspiring entrepreneur visiting the shops after winning a reality TV contest. And that's when he learns first-hand that the employees are the foundation of the company.

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes headlines and weather.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In this revisit episode, chef Gordon Ramsay goes back to Mojito, the Junction (formerly known as Flamangos) and Bazzini to check in with the owners he helped in the past and find out whether his advice has been put to good use. Will he be pleased with their progress?

programme.title: Steph's Packed Lunch
programme.desc: Steph McGovern presents the weekday magazine, including celebrity guests, food ideas, real-life features and entertainment, lifestyle and consumer stories. Plus, a sideways look at the news in One O'Clock Views.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the words-and-numbers game where contestants pit their wits against the clock. Jon Culshaw is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Paul and Debbie from Staffordshire would love to find a holiday home on the beautiful island of Fuerteventura where they can enjoy spending quality time together. They're looking for a two-bedroom apartment near the attractive coastal town of Caleta de Fuste and have a budget of £115,000. Ben Hillman shows them five properties from them to choose between.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Cameras revisit two pensioners struggling to bring their favourite British pastime to France and reveal how two twenty-somethings got on launching an Irish bar on the Costa del Sol.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last day of the competition sees the B&Bers eager to challenge each other about the feedback they've received, as Toni from Woodleys Farmhouse wants to know how she can improve her breakfast service. When one pair accuses another of game playing, things start to get emotional before the winning B&B is announced.

programme.title: Drawers Off
programme.desc: Gaming enthusiast Chris is the last model of the week, as the artists compete for the final chance to enter the winners' gallery. Just one place remains before the group decide which is the best life drawing produced by the class, and Jenny crowns the Drawers Off artist of the week. Hosted by Jenny Eclair.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and his boss Mr Burns are trapped in a mountain cabin during a survival trip with the power plant employees, and find themselves forced to work together as equals to survive - but the strain of isolation soon takes its toll.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sylver has a surprise for Cher as he tries to make her feel more accepted. Meanwhile, Mandy tries to protect herself and Ella as the net closes in on them.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.

programme.title: Grayson's Art Club
programme.desc: Grayson and Philippa Perry are joined by TV presenter Sue Perkins, who crafts an unusual work of art on the subject of food. Grayson also talks to Rose Wylie, who became an art world star in her seventies. There's a peek inside the studio of Lucy Sparrow, who uses felt to create colourful replicas of everyday food items, while comedian Mawaan Rizwan makes his own piece of food-related art. Plus, special guest Nigella Lawson helps choose the favourite public art submissions of the week.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, as cameras capture their instant reactions prompted by the week's biggest and best shows, be they entertainment juggernauts, hard-hitting documentaries, news reports or gritty dramas.

programme.title: The Celebrity Circle for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: The Circle is divided as all the celebrity players compete for immunity. The stakes are high as the players face the most brutal blocking yet.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: London market trader Dave hopes he can win over his date with some good old-fashioned banter - so when he is paired with Sara, who wants to meet a `proper East End geezer', they hit it off straight away. But how will he react when she reveals her marriage lasted only five days? Dennis and Chris suspect they might have found the one when they spot that they are wearing matching trainers, while hospice worker Cora sits down with avid dancer Neil - but when she reveals she hates technology, he wonders if they are on the same wavelength. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: Futuristic thriller starring Frank Grillo and Elizabeth Mitchell. Senator Charlie Roan is running for US President with a promise to end the annual tradition of 'Purge Night', in which all crime is legal for a 12-hour window. As the latest Purge nears, Roan becomes a target, so she hires ex cop Leo Barnes to keep her alive through the night, by any means necessary.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dry-cleaning manager Valerie hosts the first dinner party in Lancashire, where she plans to impress her guests with a lamb hotpot and trifle. However, it remains to be seen whether her warm-hearted hospitality will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize by the end of the week.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance teacher Nicky hosts the second night in Lancashire, where she hopes to impress her guests with a round-the-world themed menu inspired by her dancing tours, which includes a Chinese salmon starter, and an American dessert. However, with fellow contestant Peggy born in the United States, the host may have her work cut out in presenting the perfect dish.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Outsourcing manager Steve hosts the third night in Lancashire, where the 51-year-old plans to wow his guests with a `man of the world' menu that relies heavily on strong Indian spices. Peggy picks him up on his shop-bought black pudding, while Nicky is unimpressed by the mildness of the chicken balti, resulting in a humiliating chilli-sauce challenge.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: American Peggy hosts a USA-themed dinner party on the fourth night of the competition in Lancashire, and hopes her Arizonan recipes will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize. Her menu comprises tried and tested dishes, including her dessert of peach dump cake. However, friction between her and fellow contestant Steve continues to build.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party in Lancashire, and the turn of sales manager Andy to host. He is confident in his locally sourced gastro menu and delivers a meal with plenty of flair, but faces the challenge of impressing foodie Nicky. He is also under pressure to convince American Peggy of the merits of the region's food, while his fellow Lancastrians Valerie and Steve are keen to see how the area has influenced his cooking.

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The host helps Leicester couple James and Drew restore their period house, reclaiming its classic Georgian dimensions and features. In Brixton, south London, a Victorian living room has had all its period features ripped out and replaced with 1970s kitsch and fake Tudor. Can George turn this travesty into a smart and sophisticated family sitting room? Plus, he visits a 300-year-old silk weaver's house in Spitalfields, London, that is perfectly adapted for stylish modern living.

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz, in which 15 contestants are pitted against one another in the hope of securing a place in the end-of-series final when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is depressed that everyone seems to be paired off except him, and resorts to desperate measures to get a girlfriend. Meanwhile, Sheldon looks for a way out of his relationship with Amy, who wants him to meet her mother. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's sister Priya visits the gang, causing tension when Leonard tries to cover up the fling he once had with her. After discovering his friend's secret, Sheldon struggles to keep quiet, leading the guys to reveal information they have all been keeping from one another.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard vows to be more self-assured around women, believing his problem attracting a girlfriend stems from a lack of confidence. An FBI agent interviews the gang to assess Howard's suitability for a team working on a new surveillance satellite. Guest starring Eliza Dushku.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Dan Jones examines Britain's most iconic canals, beginning with the 152-mile Grand Union Canal, which runs up the spine of the country. Constructed at the height of the Industrial Revolution, the task challenged even the greatest engineering minds of the time, including pioneers such as James Brindley, the man behind Britain's first commercial canal, and William Jessop, the person with whom responsibility lay for the building of the main link from Birmingham to London. Travelling along its route, Dan experiences first-hand the innovations behind its construction, including the Blisworth tunnel.

programme.desc: The comedian aboard her vintage camper van, explores the mountainous region of north-west England and the Lake District. She begins her 142-mile journey just south of Penrith, travelling down through the lakes, before heading west to finish near Keswick. Along the way she meets the people and visits the places that make this most scenic part of Britain unique. On Ullswater, Susan gets a chance to take charge of the oldest working passenger vessel in the world, the Lady of the Lake. Then she hears of Beatrix Potter's love of the region before heading the spooky Muncaster Castle.

Italy have continued to struggle in this year's competition, suffering heavy defeats against France, England and Ireland. In contrast, after a disappointing campaign last time out, Wales have already secured the Triple Crown and will have high hopes of emulating their Grand Slam triumph of 2018. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary by Miles Harrison, David Flatman and Shane Williams.

programme.title: Six Nations Live

France have not won here in this competition since 2005, but will have high hopes of ending that barren run given their 24-17 home win in last season's competition and England's defeats at home to Scotland and away to Wales this time around. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Serge Betsen, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Roger talks Francine into taking advantage of Stan's absence by playing the `Widow Game', which involves the two of them posing as widows in order to gain sympathy - and free stuff. Meanwhile, Steve and his friends stage wrestling matches in the basement, but things get out of hand when an uninvited participant shows up.

programme.title: New Amsterdam
programme.desc: With the hospital on lockdown after the Rikers patients escape, Sharpe and Max find themselves in a situation that could cost them their lives. Bloom must put aside her pain to help a patient, while Iggy is forced to face his marriage's issues. Medical drama, starring Ryan Eggold.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff at St George's Hospital tackle one of their most dramatic emergencies when 60-year-old rail worker Alan is airlifted to the helipad after being hit by a high-speed train. A CT scan reveals he has suffered multiple fractures and loss of blood flow to his right arm. Without circulation he will lose the limb, so the medical team tries everything to save it, including complicated surgery. Meanwhile, 95-year-old Betty is brought in after experiencing breathing difficulties at home, and retired engineer James, 63, has a nasty cut to his head and weakness in his arms following a tumble down the stairs.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team returns to explore the secrets behind mass-produced food, meeting technicians, scientists, factory owners, growers and producers, finding out exactly what goes into the everyday groceries that end up on the supermarket shelves. Jimmy Doherty finds out how Sri Lanka is coping with a looming coconut shortage, while Kate Quilton discovers whether compostables could be the answer to worldwide plastic pollution problem, annd Matt Tebbutt is in Paris to learn why the macaron has such a hefty price tag.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Max McMurdo head to Wales to see how can create the most profit on items, including an oil dispenser, fire grate, chaise longue and even a catamaran.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien attempt to restore items including an old cheese press, and a 1980s motorbike almost gets the better of Henry and his restorer Guy.

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Angel transforms the attic into a studio and storage space for her vintage treasures and takes Dorothy on a trip to Paris, while Dick has his own plans for repurposing some ancient tools he finds in the outbuildings. The couple throws a surprise birthday celebration for Angel's mother, where Dick's purpose-built open-fire popcorn maker is put to the test.

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton meets Juana and Trevor Jones, who plan to knock down some 300-year-old decrepit barns, and build themselves a stylish retirement home in the Lincolnshire countryside. While sceptical about their ability to do this on a £100,000 budget, Charlie soon realises goung over-budget may be the least of the couple's problems. Ex-builder Trevor is determined to be hands-on with the project, and even refuses to down tools when he is facing a life-saving operation.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Inn at the Park in Aberdeen, where for owners Ronnie and Steph Caird, it's all about keeping it in the family. When the guests arrive, design-conscious father and son Steve and Allard take a trip back in time, and John isn't flushed with praise for his bathroom. At dinner, John reveals his culinary background, piling on the pressure for Ronnie to deliver a good breakfast. Fiona and Shauna's sizeable confession raises eyebrows, while in the morning, Ronnie has a breakfast to forget and the bathroom blues leave Ronnie and Steph seeking answers from their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the group heads to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District, where owners Steve and Allard Newell have proudly built their B&B from the ground up.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests stay at the Lynbar Hotel in Blackpool, where Ronnie and Steph have parking problems, while confident owner John O'Donnell boasts of serving the best breakfast in town.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to settle some scores. Inn at the Park owners Ronnie and Steph Caird are intent on clearing up John's issues with the toilet.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Wokingham in Berkshire to meet professional gardener Mark whose barns are brimful of bikes, bric-a-brac and baggage.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Giant otter couple Diego and Icana are the best of friends but have never mated, so keepers hope a new male will have what it takes to relight Icana's fire. Blue morpho butterflies Macuna and Peanut also need to mate, but when their diet of fruit ferments and turns to alcohol, their drunken behaviour might dash Chester's hopes of producing the next generation of butterflies. Cameras also follow the relationship between mum-and-daughter Andrean bears Lima and Madidi, who are fighting over food and personal space. Can the youngster learn to respect her elder?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Angel redesigns the rooms in one of the chateau's turrets with a fruits and flowers motif - but an unexpected surprise lurks behind her creations. programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down

programme.title: Deutschland 89

Brigitte Winkelmann and CIA agent Hector Valdez task Martin with infiltrating a group of West Germans. Rose pays Lenora a visit, while Schweppenstette begrudgingly accepts a mission in Frankfurt. Drama, starring Jonas Nay, Raul Casso and Maria Schrader. In German.

Ciaran, 27, injured his ankle the previous night while out with friends and was given a temporary cast. Emergency nurse practitioner Helen needs to get him X-rayed and replastered, but he faces a return visit for an operation.

programme.desc: House hunter Zane wants to permanently relocate to Mijas in Spain to be closer to his son Dean, who has already moved there with his family. Danni Menzies shows the father and son five properties within the £110,000 budget, hoping at least one will prove perfect.

Meanwhile in Hertfordshire, Phil tries to find home for three generations of females moving out of London.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dairy farmer's wife and Disney enthusiast Charlene Fry-Henderson hosts the first dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, where she hopes that her locally reared meat, home cooking, and entertainment involving a plastic cow will secure her the £1,000 prize. Her guests are local radio presenter Tommy Jardine, banker Olive Melville, prison custody officer Tammy Rice and trainee teacher Josh Jones.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Horse enthusiast and banker Olive Melville hosts the second dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, where she hopes to impress her guests with a crab starter and mousse dessert - but things take a turn for the worse when a conversation about the royal family divides the diners.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Local radio DJ Tommy Jardine hosts the third dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, and prepares chicken stuffed with haggis - but first he must continue a family tradition and rustle up a sheep for his entertainment. Tommy then tries to impress his guests with a touch of celebrity name-dropping, but young dance DJ and trainee teacher Josh trumps him at his own game.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee teacher and club DJ Josh Jones hosts the fourth night in Dumfries and Galloway, and hopes he can broaden his fellow contestants' palates with his menu of Indian food. He plans lamb pasanda and tandoori monkfish, but Tammy Rice finds something in her glass that wasn't on the menu. However, Josh hopes his disco entertainment might impress the guests enough to bag him the £1,000 prize.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tammy Rice hosts the final evening in Dumfries and Galloway, hoping to win the £1,000 prize with her no-nonsense approach and traditional Scottish fare. The dinner-party novice rustles up chorizo and cous cous stuffed peppers for her starter and incorporates haggis into her chicken-based main course.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Claire Hilton, who runs Robertsbrook Guest House in Swanage, Dorset, feels she has a good chance of winning the title of best B&B as another round of the competition gets under way. However, guests Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome have doubts over the cleanliness of their bedroom, and another couple are accustomed to more opulent surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome hope to impress with their two-star B&B Eden Lodge in Falmouth, Cornwall. However, the state of their property disappoints their fellow competitors. At dinner, James and Maria Church reveal the truth about their famous daughter Charlotte, and the following morning's breakfast reduces some of the guests to fits of giggles.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It is the turn of Charlotte Church's parents James and Maria to play host at Dexby Townhouse in Cardiff, and they pull out all the stops by laying on a day of white-water rafting and a magic performance courtesy of their nephew Elliot. But the following morning, some of the guests are kept waiting for breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Newlyweds Pip Easby and Nicky Lesser-Easby, who run Muddifords Court Country House in Devon, open their doors for the final stay of the competition. The Churches find their four-poster bed too small, and not all the guests enjoy their trip to a local glass-blowing factory, but feedback at check-out time leaves the hosts feeling confident.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. An underpayment from a surprising source changes the dynamics of the group and throws the competition wide open, before the winner is announced.

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Two-and-a-half years have passed since Dick and Angel Strawbridge swapped their flat in Southend for a 19th-century chateau in France costing only £280,000, and in that time, the pair have worked to transform the derelict property into a fairytale castle. However, around half of the 45 rooms are yet to receive adequate attention, the couple's fledgling events business demands attention, and the outbuildings are still in need of conversion.

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the archaeologists set out to uncover evidence of a secret military base on the clifftops of South Shields, hopping to become the first to put these important pieces of wartime history on the map. Last in the series.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Tree surgeon David, 27, is airlifted to St George's after falling 40ft to the ground, hitting several branches on his way down and landing head-first onto concrete. Having been knocked unconscious for 10 minutes, the medical team must urgently assess him for internal injuries. Anne, 74, arrives with a sharp pain in her chest, 51-year-old taxi driver Mark receives treatment for a cut on his finger caused by broken glass, and 92-year-old Betty is brought in by ambulance after her carers found her with slurred speech and a shaking hand.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Bob, 51, is airlifted to St George's after falling 20ft from a ladder while repairing his roof. With debris in his wound, doctors are concerned he could develop a life-threatening infection. Retired pharmacologist Anthony, 68, receives help for a chronic gas problem, while 83-year-old Gladys collapsed on the stairs at home and has a dangerously low heart rate.

programme.title: Japan's Tsunami: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Amateur footage and eyewitness accounts telling the story of the earthquake and subsequent tsunami that caused devastation in Japan in March 2011. The film also discovers how the country dealt with the aftermath of these natural disasters, as people struggled to rebuild their lives and communities.

programme.title: The Celebrity Circle for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Famous faces compete to be crowned The Circle's most popular celebrity player. The game heats up as alliances form and suspicions increase, Charlotte Crosby joins The Celebrity Circle, and a catfish makes a terrible mistake.

programme.desc: When parasites threaten to take over the world by placing memories in people's heads and multiplying through flashbacks, the Smith house is locked down. Rick warns the family to be cautious of wacky, zany characters that may appear, and decides to build blast shields around the house to stop people coming it or out.

programme.title: Robot Chicken
programme.desc: Liam Neeson demonstrates his `very particular set of skills' when he discovers his seat at the cinema has been taken. Plus, Monster High steals the Crypt Keeper's gimmick.

programme.desc: Somebody or something is kidnapping the town's good guys, so Sheriff sets out to prove that he is the `goodest' guy in town.

In this episode they appraise The Greatest Dancer, Small Fortune, Cold Feet, Famous and Fighting Crime, The Making of Me and the news.

programme.desc: Tension mounts when the pals attend a weekend science conference. Howard becomes argumentative after Bernadette runs into a former boyfriend, and the fallout causes chaos with the hotel room arrangements. Rick Fox guest stars, with Simon Helberg and Melissa Rauch.

programme.desc: After watching a particular game show together for years, Adam and Emmy are excited to learn that the producers will be holding auditions at their school. Beverly turns to Bill for help when Barry and Murray become convinced that she is a lucky charm for their beleaguered football team.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The cops of the 99th Precinct become the latest victim of the Vulture, a detective from Major Crimes with a habit of taking over investigations just as they are about to be solved. However, Jake is determined not to let the hotshot steal his thunder and races to close his case first. Meanwhile, Holt and Gina help Terry regain his right to carry a gun.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The precinct's staff prepare for an unusually busy night as the neighbourhood gets into the Halloween spirit, and Amy falls into a particularly foul mood when she is forced to wear a fancy-dress costume during an undercover operation. Meanwhile, Jake bets Captain Holt that he can steal his Medal of Valour before midnight - a challenge that prompts him to don his own selection of disguises.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: The couples wrap up their honeymoons and head back to Sydney for the very first dinner party where they will meet each other for the first time.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy and Penny use Bernadette to spy on Leonard and Priya after the couple invite her and Howard to dinner. An experimental drug helps Raj overcome his fear of talking to women, but proves more effective than he had expected. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard decides to tell his mother that he and Bernadette are engaged - but she later collapses, making him fear the shock of the news has caused her to suffer a heart attack. As the gang convenes at the hospital, Sheldon's fear of infectious diseases lands him in trouble, while Priya and Penny bond over coffee.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: It's Darren and Mandy's wedding day, but the odds are stacked against them. Meanwhile, Ollie has a choice to make between Victor and Brooke.

programme.title: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.desc: Hannah continues to struggle working under Captain Sandy. Bobby develops a crush on Malia and rushes to her aid when she suffers a freak accident.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy pulls out all the stops as she hosts a traditional Victorian Christmas Eve dinner for the friends. Meanwhile, Raj's father comes to visit, and the guys do their best to free a bird they accidentally let into the university clean room. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: A fast-talking former mercenary develops terminal cancer, and agrees to be the subject in a shady experiment in the hope of a cure. The procedure leaves him horribly disfigured, but also possessing superhuman abilities which he immediately puts to use in a quest for revenge on the man responsible for his hideous appearance. Superhero comedy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson guides contestants through the game of choosing a partner naked, as they must whittle six contenders down to one with whom to share a date. Here, sick of the party lifestyle, 27-year-old former club rep Chris, from London, hopes to meet someone to settle down with. Next up is 27-year-old technophobe Louise, from Buckinghamshire, who hasn't so far embraced the modern way of dating. A fan of classic romantic novels, Louise is looking for an old fashioned gentleman to sweep her off her feet.

programme.title: The Celebrity Circle for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: The Circle is divided as all the celebrity players compete for immunity. The stakes are high as the players face the most brutal blocking yet.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share more of their insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of the week's biggest and best shows, including This Morning, The Chase Celebrity Special, Baptiste, The Sex Clinic and Child Genius. Narrated by Craig Cash. First aired in March 2019.

programme.title: Celebs Go Dating
programme.desc: Dean Gaffney seeks wooing wisdom from old friend Richard Blackwood. Charlotte and Matt are sent to a spa to reconnect and Liv meets a new man who seems like a good match.

programme.title: Wife Swap Australia
programme.desc: Alise Andrew, a mum to a quadruplet of nine-year-old boys, swaps lives with Cassie Lister - a militant mum who keeps her two kids' tech-time rationed.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels threatened by a 15-year-old physics prodigy who is even cleverer than he is, and asks Leonard to help him discredit the precocious teenager's research. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard's fear of commitment causes him to avoid Bernadette, but he soon realises he has made a mistake and tries to compensate for it. Meanwhile, Kripke plays a prank during a radio interview with Sheldon, who sets out to get revenge, only to be caught by the Dean. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with an appearance by Katee Sackhoff (Battlestar Galactica) as herself.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette asks Leonard about his physics experiment, making Howard so jealous that she threatens to end their relationship. Penny also feels put out by the situation, and asks Sheldon to teach her about science. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Melissa Rauch star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj endures an anxious day as he worries that a space probe he helped design will not function properly, while Leonard and Sheldon agree to go clothes shopping with Penny and Amy. Comedy, starring Kunal Nayyar, Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Groom-to-be Chris decides to turn his wedding into the ultimate obstacle course, but his fiancee Charlotte dreams of a wedding day filled with family tradition.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Former boxing champ and groom-to-be Jordan plans a fight-night wedding in front of thousands of people, but his fiancee Danielle dreams of a girly and intimate wedding day.

programme.title: Supernanny USA
programme.desc: Jo Frost meets Michael and Angela Brown, who are having attachment issues with sons Michael Jo and Paul Mason because of their giant family bed.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Eagle Rock in California to try to change the fortunes of Capri, a grubby restaurant which often remains closed during lunchtime because of the twin owners' lazy attitude. A crisis ensues as soon as Gordon Ramsay instructs the duo to clean the place, revealing that only tough measures are likely to save the business.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In this revisit episode, chef Gordon Ramsay goes back to Mojito, the Junction (formerly known as Flamangos) and Bazzini to check in with the owners he helped in the past and find out whether his advice has been put to good use. Will he be pleased with their progress?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Stuart takes Penny out for a second date, during which she drunkenly reveals her true feelings. Meanwhile, Howard uncovers a flaw in the toilet he designed for a Nasa space shuttle, and asks his friends to help him correct it before the launch. Kaley Cuoco, Kevin Sussman and Simon Helberg star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon wins a grant to pay for a summer expedition to the North Pole, and invites his friends to join him. However, the gang's imminent departure causes Leonard and Penny to reconsider their feelings for each other. Johnny Gale and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon returns to Texas in disgrace when he discovers his friends tampered with the Arctic expedition data after growing tired of his quest for a scientific breakthrough. Elsewhere, Leonard becomes frustrated as constant interruptions hamper his attempts to woo Penny.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Howard stake their most coveted comic books on a bet over the species of a cricket, while Leonard and Penny struggle to recover from an awkward first night together. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon succeeds in getting Penny to conform to his high standards, so Leonard adopts a similar strategy for his romantic gain. Meanwhile, Howard and Raj meet two women at a goth nightclub and things appear to go well - until they are taken to a tattoo parlour.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj accepts Sheldon's offer to work for him as he is desperate to avoid being sent back to India. Howard starts spending more time with Leonard and Penny, who would rather be left alone. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's in Plainfield, New Jersey, but struggles to get his message across to indomitable owner Shelley. Her refusal to deal with the truth comes to a head when Gordon finds a dead mouse in the doorway, prompting him to step up his efforts to change her ways.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations.

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: The charity version of the popular baking show returns, and with Noel Fielding on paternity leave, Matt Lucas is presenting on his own. In previous editions, comedian Tom Allen has stepped in to co-present - but today he is showing off his baking skills as one of the contestants, alongside Star Wars actress Daisy Ridley, comedian Rob Beckett and singer Alexandra Burke. To impress Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith, the celebrities serve up millionaire shortbread, a fruity tart and their pet hates in cake form in the showstopper.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is given the chance to square off against the one actor from the Star Trek franchise he holds a grudge against - Wil Wheaton. Meanwhile, Leonard asks Penny to set Howard up on a date with one of her friends. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard worries his lack of American football knowledge is alienating him from Penny and her friends. However, he finds an unlikely sporting tutor in the form of Sheldon, who reluctantly spent most of his childhood attending games with his father. Meanwhile, Raj is infuriated when Howard abandons him to pursue a girl at a kite-fighting contest.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy pulls out all the stops as she hosts a traditional Victorian Christmas Eve dinner for the friends. Meanwhile, Raj's father comes to visit, and the guys do their best to free a bird they accidentally let into the university clean room. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 1
programme.desc: Action adventure starring Jennifer Lawrence. Having survived two Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen is taken to the underground District 13. There she meets the rebel leader President Alma Coin who asks the inspirational Katniss to become a spearhead in their push against the might of the Capitol.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The locked-down armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Jamie Oliver's Keep Cooking and Carry On, Celebrity Murder Mystery, Joe Wicks on The Andrew Marr Show, The Nest, This Morning with dog yoga, The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer; Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip and news coverage of the coronavirus.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of programmes including The Crown, We Are the Champions, Strictly Come Dancing, The Undoing, The Great British Bake Off, The Toe Bro and news reports on the Covid vaccine and possible restrictions on family gatherings at Christmas.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Politics Live, After Life, Dancing on Ice: The Final, Only Connect, Cheat, and Baewatch: Parental Guidance. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes. Narrated by Craig Cash. From March 2019.

programme.title: Our Baby: A Modern Miracle
programme.desc: Documentary following transgender couple Hannah and Jake Graf as they start a family. Filmed over the course of a year, the programme follows Hannah and Jake from their first meeting with a surrogate through to their baby's birth in the midst of lockdown. The film also explores their experiences of transitioning and the prejudice they've faced, as they strive to realise their dream of becoming parents.

programme.title: The Undateables
programme.desc: Emily, who has a learning disability, is determined to find her first proper boyfriend, but she has to overcome her nerves and her tendency to talk too much. Meanwhile, Poetry lover Michael, who has Asperger's, has been single for 14 years and hopes he can one day find love, and dance teacher Tobi is fearless on the dance floor, but is something of a novice when it comes to romance.

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Wood Green animal charity, who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. An eight-stone Newfoundland makes a favourable first impression on the Coxon family, but staff are worried that his habit of showering everyone with a spray of slobber may take some of the gloss off. Nine-week-old French bulldog Kevin competes with a nervous terrier to win the hearts of loved-up couple Ryan and Katie, while a recently widowed grandmother seeks another `beating heart' to help fill a home that is feeling very empty.

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick treats a Persian cat that has been hit by a car, requiring treatments involving a skin graft and putting its crushed bones back together. Meanwhile, a rescue dog has a cancerous tumour in his jaw removed, and a young staffie-cross needs treatment for a developmental elbow disease.

programme.title: Drawers Off
programme.desc: Graphic designer Alpha takes his turn to model for the group. Abstract artist Jilly sees something in Alpha's choice of pose that nobody else does. Jon tries out a different drawing style, while Steph experiments with an unusual tool to add texture to her work. Presented by Jenny Eclair.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Cameras return to France, three years on, to catch up with two campsite owners whose strict rules on-site have apparently put their business at risk. After facing a major setback in their first year, have a pair of hoteliers managed to stay the course? Plus, a revisit to an enterprising couple in Spain as their handmade soap and candle company takes a new direction to survive.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Photographer Nat and budding artist and writer Ruth from Leicester fell in love with Tarn in France on holiday and were so inspired by the region's quaint villages and beautiful scenery that they now want to buy their very own holiday home there. Laura Hamilton lines up five properties for their budget of £90,000, but will any of them be the perfect place?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Peter and Julia Andrews from Hull love Fuerteventura in the Canary Islands and want to buy a holiday home there, which their whole family can enjoy. Armed with a budget of £60,000, Sara Damergi scours the island for five perfect lock-up-and-leave properties, but will any of them make the grade?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Gary and Carol from Kent seek a home in Aquitaine, France, so house-hunting expert Laura Hamilton tries to find them the perfect property.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist and female impersonator Marcus Hunter-Neill hopes to impress with a red carpet-themed evening as he hosts the first party in Belfast. However, his alter ego Lady Portia Diamante steals the limelight as he competes for the £1,000 prize.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jamaican lifeguard Lenny Irving serves up Caribbean cuisine at the second of the week's dinner parties in Belfast. He also hopes to win over his guests by complementing his menu with strong rum - and seems particularly keen to impress Merchant Navy officer Fiona Rush.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Freelance feminist writer Cat Anderson hosts the third dinner party in Belfast, and hopes to win over her guests with her bohemian chic style and live music. However, her efforts are wasted on lifeguard Lenny Irving, who is only interested in Fiona Rush.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner-party challenge from Belfast is hosted by charity worker and confident cook Rosie Smyth. She decides the best way to win over her guests is to have a `come-as-your-teenage-self' evening, and a zingy mojito cheesecake.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Merchant Navy officer Fiona Rush hosts the final dinner party in Belfast, and hopes to impress with a nautical-themed evening. However, one of her guests is unimpressed with the amount of fish on the menu, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to Charlie's Italian bistro in La Verne, southern California, where the owner's lack of business nous is putting her relatives' homes at risk, after her mother and sister put them up as collateral. To make matters worse, the restaurant's food is less than appetising and its long-serving chef seems to be incompetent.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Paul and Debbie from Staffordshire would love to find a holiday home on the beautiful island of Fuerteventura where they can enjoy spending quality time together. They're looking for a two-bedroom apartment near the attractive coastal town of Caleta de Fuste and have a budget of £115,000. Ben Hillman shows them five properties from them to choose between.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Gary and Carol from Kent seek a home in Aquitaine, France, so house-hunting expert Laura Hamilton tries to find them the perfect property.

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Cornish adaptive surfer Pegleg plans to extend his VW campervan by creating a new cabin from scratch, while Martin and Carol-Anne want to build a glamping pod in their Pembrokeshire garden, using a dome that originally housed an electricity generator at the London Olympics. George also visits an earthquake-resistant glass house on the coast of western Japan, and looks at aluminium panels as a new kind of canopy for his treehouse.

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The host visits Ben at his ground floor apartment in St Leonards-on-Sea, East Sussex. George's challenge is to turn a grand drawing room with sea views into a cool, elegant kitchen-diner and create rich, opulent schemes for a bedroom and study. In Manchester, he tackles a 1930s semi-detached where the compact dimensions are proving a headache. With only a tiny budget to work with, can he make a cramped galley kitchen both functional and beautiful?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary follows the work of the stroke team at south London's King's College Hospital. Laura's family faces a big decision when the 72-year-old grandmother is found to have a blood clot on her brain.The medics also treat 83-year-old Marjorie, who is complaining of a pain behind her eye following a recent bout of shingles, and 84-year-old Ronald, who has been bitten by his own dog.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: A 23-year-old virgin from Kent picks a partner from six nude candidates - but this proves a nerve-racking experience, since he has never seen a naked woman in his life. Meanwhile, a 27-year-old beauty therapist from London is determined to have a baby before she turns 30, and hopes that one of the men lurking behind the screens will be the perfect father.

programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, as cameras capture their instant reactions prompted by the week's biggest and best shows, be they entertainment juggernauts, hard-hitting documentaries, news reports or gritty dramas.

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
