They must make a decorative chamber pot and a fully functional pedestal sink, before judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller decide which three potters will be going through to the final.

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Wood Green animal charity, who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. An eight-stone Newfoundland makes a favourable first impression on the Coxon family, but staff are worried that his habit of showering everyone with a spray of slobber may take some of the gloss off. Nine-week-old French bulldog Kevin competes with a nervous terrier to win the hearts of loved-up couple Ryan and Katie, while a recently widowed grandmother seeks another `beating heart' to help fill a home that is feeling very empty.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Blacksmiths Boutique in Whitby, North Yorkshire, where things turn ugly at dinner as hosts Nick and Sarah Allison are grilled about their facilities.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the White Hart Hotel in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, where management team Chris Clarke and Katie Light introduce their guests to some llamas.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to budget option New Promenade Hotel in Blackpool, owned by Raouf Elnagaar, who is joined by friend Chrissie Greenwood.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, Vicky Crawford welcomes her rivals to her three-bedroom terraced house in Oxford, aptly named The Terrace. But two pairs of guests discover an array of filthy finds, including thick dust, hairs and a pre-sucked sweet. In the afternoon the guests go punting, but Raouf's childish mood spoils their time on the river.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Tall John's House, Robin and Liza Watson's grand Georgian mansion in the Welsh countryside, where the guests are wowed by the historic building and rooms. Raouf, Chrissie, Clarkey and Katie dig deep to find fault but can only find small problems. Following an afternoon in the billiard room, the guests gush over their friendship at dinner but, when it comes to the question of future meet-ups, Vicky drops a bombshell.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: White Hart Hotel management team Clarkey and Katie raise the issue of paying for their car park as the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A family from Hull running a successful B&B in France plan another move. Plus, catching up with a catering business on the Costa del Sol and a pair of sailing instructors.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Two years after launching a brewery in France, an Essex couple may have become victims of their own success. The owners of a boat charter business in Alicante have a new plan.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A Spanish cookery school whose owners took an expensive gamble to expand their business, and a pair of holiday hosts who opened an estate agency to secure their future in Spain. Plus, a Shropshire couple looking to double the size of their treehouse B&B business in France.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Catching up with a couple who opened a cycle retreat in Spain and two gite owners who got more than they bargained for after starting a holiday business in France three years ago.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Cameras revisit two pensioners struggling to bring their favourite British pastime to France and reveal how two twenty-somethings got on launching an Irish bar on the Costa del Sol.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Road Trip
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix's European tour moves on to his native France, where he explores the Bordeaux and Bergerac wine regions. He meets a pair of English winemakers who are trying to make a name for themselves, and a sommelier and his chef wife, who are launching a gîte and a cookery school.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Almeria
programme.desc: Guy and Julie Sadler from Brighton have travelled all around the world together and have long dreamed of relocating somewhere warm. Now, although they've never been to Spain, they've decided that Almería has the perfect balance of sunshine and affordable property. Laura Hamilton shows them five homes for their £100,000 budget.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps Michelle and David from Liverpool search for a holiday home on Spain's Costa del Sol with a budget of £60,000.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Gary and Carol from Kent seek a home in Aquitaine, France, so house-hunting expert Laura Hamilton tries to find them the perfect property.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two bungalows requiring different solutions. In Purley, Croydon, Christine Attwood and Tony Congdon have been going back and forth for almost a decade about the future of their unusual bungalow. In Larne in Northern Ireland, Catherine and Nigel Finch have hit a spot of turbulence due to their dated, 1970s-style home. Nigel enjoys the rural location's incredible views, but Catherine has never loved the place and misses having neighbours, so Phil searches for a home that pleases them both.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets architect and shed fanatic Micah Jones, who plans to transform an old agricultural building in Co Down. Micah plans an upside-down, four-bedroom shed using new techniques and materials, but the £200,000 budget runs short and Micah is forced to take on some of the building work himself.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: A 23-year-old virgin from Kent picks a partner from six nude candidates - but this proves a nerve-racking experience, since he has never seen a naked woman in his life. Meanwhile, a 27-year-old beauty therapist from London is determined to have a baby before she turns 30, and hopes that one of the men lurking behind the screens will be the perfect father.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A young man who has had a severe reaction to a recreational drug is wheeled into resus by paramedics, and senior sister Jen and the medical team face a challenge to calm their patient down so they can treat him. A 65-year-old woman is brought in by her best friends after hitting her head when she fell off a chair while playing bingo, and a 31-year-old man with multiple sclerosis is rushed in after developing a fever at home.

programme.title: Hyena
programme.desc: A corrupt cop with access to all the money and drugs he needs suddenly finds his comfortable way of life turned upside down by the arrival of ruthless Albanian gangsters in his patch of London. Crime thriller, starring Peter Ferdinando, Stephen Graham and Neil Maskell.

programme.title: The Stranger
programme.desc: Thriller starring Edward G Robinson, Loretta Young and Orson Welles. In the aftermath of the Second World War, an American agent is assigned to trail a Nazi war criminal who is released in the hope that he will attempt to contact his superior, one of the key figures in the Final Solution.

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes: Talking Film
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: Two Rode Together
programme.desc: Western starring James Stewart and Richard Widmark. Corrupt lawman Guthrie McCabe is enlisted by army officer Jim Gary to help rescue some hostages held by a Comanche tribe.

programme.title: The Longest Day
programme.desc: Second World War drama starring John Wayne, Robert Mitchum, Henry Fonda and Robert Ryan. Normandy, 6 June 1944: as the huge task of preparing for D-Day draws to a close, the Allied commanders await suitable weather conditions to set in motion history's greatest amphibious operation.

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes: Talking Film
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb
programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring Ben Stiller. Larry Daley, night guard at the New York museum where exhibits come to life after dark, has to travel to the British Museum in London to consult an ancient pharaoh who holds the secret to the magic.

programme.title: The Last Stand
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Forest Whitaker. A disgraced Los Angeles sheriff is living out the days to his retirement in a sleepy border town. But he faces one final test, as a ruthless drugs lord who has escaped FBI custody heads his way, determined to cross into Mexico.

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: Science-fiction thriller starring Kate Mara, Paul Giamatti and Anya Taylor-Joy. Morgan is a lab-created human who reaches levels of sophistication that even her creators cannot believe. But when tragedy strikes, the decision must be made as to what is actually real and what is artificial.

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Comedy starring Amy Poehler and Tina Fey. Two sisters return to their family home and throw one final, totally unforgettable party before their parents sell the property.

programme.title: Carry On Sergeant
programme.desc: Comedy starring William Hartnell and Bob Monkhouse. Sergeant Grimshawe's ambition to create a formidable platoon of National Servicemen before his retirement is dealt a blow when he finds himself in charge of a group of incompetents.

programme.title: Rio 2
programme.desc: Animated comedy sequel, featuring the voices of Jesse Eisenberg and Anne Hathaway. Can Blu the macaw cope without his creature comforts when he ventures with his family into the Amazon rainforest? The stakes rise when illegal loggers arrive on the scene and the macaws are forced to defend their habitat.

programme.title: Flight of the Navigator
programme.desc: Science-fiction adventure starring Joey Cramer. On 4 July 1978, 12-year-old David Freeman takes a tumble and wakes up in an altered world: his home and family are changed, and a voice in his head is calling for help. Meanwhile, Nasa scientists discover a mysterious alien spacecraft. Is there a connection?

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: Comedy starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern. Eight-year-old Kevin McCallister's wish to be free of his family is realised when they accidentally set off without him for a Christmas break in Paris. Suddenly finding himself home alone, Kevin's efforts to cope with the household chores are hindered by two inept criminals attempting a robbery.

programme.title: Cowboys & Aliens
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure starring Daniel Craig and Harrison Ford. An amnesiac stranger stumbles into a desert town that's ruled by a humourless colonel. When terrifying airborne marauders attack, the amnesiac discovers his skills with a gun could help save the town's inhabitants from annihilation.

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Matt Damon, Tommy Lee Jones and Alicia Vikander. Now living in self-imposed exile, former agent Jason Bourne is contacted by an old colleague and is soon drawn into an operation to expose CIA dirty tricks. And, as Bourne well knows, nothing is as it seems and no one can be trusted.

programme.title: Feedback
programme.desc: Premiere. Jarvis Dolan, the star of successful late-night radio show The Grim Reality, experiences the worst night of his life when two armed men burst into his studio and take control of the show. He is forced to continue with the live programme, following the script of the assailants. Horror thriller, starring Eddie Marsan, Paul Anderson and Ivana Baquero.

programme.title: Deadwood
programme.desc: Wolcott continues his quest to gain control of the town's gold, but Swearengen has other ideas. Meanwhile, Alma receives a surprising offer, little realising she is about to fall victim to a malicious scheme. Drama, starring Garret Dillahunt, Ian McShane and Molly Parker.

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Jia returns to the prison after making a full recovery, while Hoyt confesses his past misdemeanours and Kirk continues planning ways to murder Cloutier. Ernie Hudson and Luke Perry star.

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Dr Nathan attacks her patient while having a flashback of her rape, while Alvarez makes a confession to Mukada after Guerra kills his follower. Hard-hitting prison drama starring Lauren Vzlez, Otto Sanchez, and Kirk Acevado.

programme.title: Californication
programme.desc: Hank is kicked out of his hotel when he runs up a $25,000 debt and is allowed to stay at Karen's, but a supposedly quiet night in with his daughter ends up in disaster. Elsewhere, Peggy confronts Charlie about his still having feelings for Marcy.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Langston returns from New York, having failed to find kidnap victim Madeline Briggs, but with a tip-off that she was seen in Vegas. A TV weather presenter who was working as a prostitute is found murdered outside a casino, and tests reveal evidence that could finally lead to the missing girl. Laurence Fishburne stars.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Greg, Nick and Hodges surprise Henry on his birthday by taking him for dinner at a remote restaurant. However, they arrive to find the place shut down, and closer inspection uncovers the body of a man who appears to have been killed during a bizarre prank. Meanwhile, Langston and Catherine suspect an old enemy has returned as they investigate the death of a woman in a wealthy entrepreneur's bathroom. Crime drama, starring Jon Wellner.

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. He begins with the chaos caused by snow and ice, using real-life studies - such as Montreal being shut down by a fierce ice storm in 1998 - and sharing incredible stories of survival. He then subjects a specially built test house to an avalanche, one of the world's deadliest natural forces.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Langston investigates the murder of a teenager who was reviled at school for his racist and homophobic views, and had a number of enemies who would have been happy to end his life. However, a more sinister motive emerges with the discovery that the youngster was trying to change his ways, and had struck up a friendship with a Rwandan janitor. Guest starring Michael K Williams (The Wire).

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Nick and Greg are puzzled when a famous comedian is found dead in his locked dressing room, with the cause of death identified as drowning. Meanwhile, Ray, Catherine and Sara investigate why a dangerous fugitive was discovered with more than 100 bullet holes in his body.

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: An intruder breaks into the Donovan household, forcing the family closer together in unexpected ways. Drama, starring Liev Schreiber and Jon Voight.

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Ray visits a Hollywood power-player and discovers a secret Ezra shared in the past, while Lena and an ex-girlfriend take Abby for a night on the town.

programme.title: Dexter
programme.desc: As Christmas approaches, Dexter tries to balance his relationships with Hannah and Debra. However, one of the women is following up on what could be an incriminating tip.

programme.title: Dexter
programme.desc: The forensic expert visits Hannah in jail to explain why he did not protect her, and she in turn discusses her actions. Meanwhile, Captain LaGuerta disregards the evidence she and Tom Matthews have discovered, which points to Sergeant Doakes as the Bay Harbour Butcher. Starring Michael C Hall.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A woman is thought to have killed her husband and children, who have been missing for three years but whose bodies have never been found. However, the case is complicated by her friendship with Jim and the involvement of a psychic, who has apparently convinced the suspect that at least one of her offspring is still alive. Crime drama, starring Paul Guilfoyle and Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: First episode of a two-part series finale. Langston's colleagues begin to suspect he may be responsible for the murder of a journalist when they learn the victim was planning to write a story accusing him of working alongside a serial killer. Their suspicions seem to be confirmed when Wendy reveals she observed him behaving strangely in recent months, while Catherine and Nick investigate his unconvincing alibi.

programme.title: Boardwalk Empire
programme.desc: Return of the drama series set in 1920s America. Nucky makes a peace offering to Joe Masseria and later argues with his brother Eli and Mayor Bader. Chalky prepares to open the Onyx Club on the Boardwalk and a new prohibition agent arrives in Atlantic City, while Tommy tries to keep the Artemis Club afloat. In Chicago, Al Capone enlists his brothers to help him expand his business. Starring Steve Buscemi and Stephen Graham.

programme.title: Boardwalk Empire
programme.desc: Now working as a delivery man for Chicago gangster Dean O'Banion, former government revenue agent Nelson Van Alden is ordered to keep tabs on Al Capone and joins the increasingly influential mobster at a political rally. Meanwhile, Harlem gangster Dr Valentin Narcisse arrives in Atlantic City, and clashes with Chalky and Nucky over the loss of an employee. When a new business opportunity crops up in Florida, Nucky heads south to the Sunshine State with hopes of adding to his fortune. Drama set during the 1920s, starring Steve Buscemi.

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Gossip is rife about Vito's secret life after he is seen in a gay bar, prompting him to go on the run. Tony and Christopher plan for Rusty's death and enlist the help of Italian-speaking heroin addict Corky Caporale, while Meadow comes to the aid of a Muslim family whose son has seemingly been unlawfully arrested. Gritty crime drama, starring James Gandolfini.

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Artie reaches crisis point as his business starts to go under in the face of fierce competition from a new restaurant. Meanwhile, Christopher and Little Carmine head west to pursue their new idea for a film, but become obsessed with stealing celebrity goodie bags, and Tony decides to take a break from the hunt for Vito. Guest starring Ben Kingsley and Lauren Bacall.

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The High Sparrow and his militant followers appear to have made an indelible mark on King's Landing as Cersei finds herself seeking forgiveness. Meanwhile, in the North, Stannis embarks on a gruelling march, and Jon is challenged, and across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys is surrounded by strangers as the fifth chapter of the hit fantasy drama draws to a close. Starring Kit Harington, Emilia Clarke, Lena Headey and Stephen Dillane.

programme.title: Band of Brothers
programme.desc: Easy Company overruns Hitler's Bavarian fortress retreat and the privates compare points to see who will be returning home as they nervously await news of their impending deployment to the Pacific. Starring Damian Lewis and Donnie Wahlberg.

programme.title: ZeroZeroZero
programme.desc: Emma and Chris manage to make their escape and arrive in Casablanca. In Monterrey, Manuel and his men protect the Leyra cartel to control the city.

programme.title: Deadwood
programme.desc: Swearengen strikes a departure deal with Miss Isringhausen and orders Farnum to befriend Blasanov so he can monitor any telegrams coming in from Yankton. Bullock gains possession of a safe full of money, while Hostetler and the General acquire a valuable wild horse they hope to sell to the cavalry. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Timothy Olyphant.

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Cyril commits a violent assault which gets him put on death row, while McManus goes in search of a drug-dealer inside the prison when he learns the truth behind Hill's illness. Said ends up in solitary when there's trouble between him and Omar White and McClain gets personal with Beecher and Keller.

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Cyril's trial gets off to a bad start, tension grows between Father Mukada and Kirk, and Beecher is unsure of violent inmate Guenzel. Alvarez is inspired with a new idea to home his trained guide dog.

programme.title: Californication
programme.desc: The day of Hank's trial arrives, and while Mia testifies that he was the victim, her father Bill provides a piece of information that could turn the jury against the writer.

programme.title: Californication
programme.desc: Hank is finally found guilty, and he considers leaving the country before the sentence is passed. However, he ends up accepting an invitation to a party at Charlie's, where he reminisces about the good old days with Marcy, Karen and the host.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A shoot-out at a gun store leaves the owner and a customer dead, and a woman's body is later found dumped by the side of a road. A bullet provides a significant link between the two cases, and the team sets about following a complicated chain of evidence to get to the truth. Crime drama, starring Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A boy's corpse is discovered among body parts in an illegal waste dump, leading Langston and Stokes to suspect elusive serial killer Dr Jekyll is responsible. Elsewhere, Catherine and Sanders search for a motive when the body of a woman is dumped in a hotel corridor. Crime drama, starring Laurence Fishburne and George Eads.

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming examines the hidden histories of cities, revealing the sights and sounds rarely witnessed by the public. He begins in London at St Paul's Cathedral, where he visits a place tourists never go, before exploring a hidden park and a little-known church. He also gets a guided tour of Soho from broadcaster Danny Baker.

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming tours the less-celebrated sights of Brighton, beginning by visiting the Toy and Model Museum to look at its collection of model trains. He then discovers a boutique that sells a variety of unusual items, before taking a glimpse behind the scenes at the Royal Pavilion.

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores the history of Bristol, beginning by learning a grisly secret at the docks before meeting Mercury Prize-winning musician Roni Size to discuss life in the St Pauls and Stokes Croft areas of the city. He also explores the district of Clifton and visits a speakeasy-style bar.

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The sudden death of a 17-year-old high-school student during a confrontation leads to the discovery of a dead cheerleader in a tree. As Ray and the team try to work out how the body got there, they uncover a strange connection to an illegal drag-racing group. Crime drama, starring Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The body of a former CIA director washes up in a swamp, and Langston suspects a revealing book he was working on could hold the key to his death. Meanwhile, a bassist in a country music band is electrocuted mid-song and Stokes and Catherine believe electrical evidence found in his guitar will help them trace the culprit. Crime drama, starring Laurence Fishburne and Jorja Fox.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The body of a 14-year-old boy is discovered in the desert, and although the team initially believes a librarian might be the killer, forensic evidence soon links his death to someone entirely different. Unfortunately the new suspect has the perfect alibi - he has been in prison for more than two years, and his lawyer immediately seizes on developments, claiming her client may have been imprisoned for a crime he did not commit.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The body of a woman found in a loading bay is identified as a hotel casino worker who appears to have been pushed down the stairs during an altercation. The victim's underwear is missing - and subsequent inquiries lead Ray and Nick into the underground fetish scene. Crime drama, starring Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Langston and the team visit a suburban crime scene where a woman, her husband and their dog have been shot, while their daughter appears to be missing. At first the evidence points to a domestic dispute, but a series of bizarre twists leads the investigators to suspect an old adversary has returned. Crime drama, starring Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Tony books into the Plaza Hotel for a little peace and quiet, but his dreams are haunted by faces from the past. Meanwhile, Johnny Sack's bid for power claims another casualty, and Tony Blundetto resolves to exact revenge. Annette Bening guest stars, and the episode features appearances from former stars of the show, including Annabella Sciorra and Joe Pantoliano.

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Adriana is forced to tell Christopher about her dealings with the FBI, and pleads with him to join her in the witness protection programme. However, the prospect of leading a normal life proves daunting to him. Tony settles his dispute with Carmela and moves back into the family home, but Johnny Sack has an ultimatum for him - if the gang war is to end, Tony Blundetto has to die.

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Tony realises it will take desperate measures to keep the peace with Johnny Sack, with fatal consequences for one of the family. Carmela worries about her son's future, Christopher comes up with a story to cover Adriana's disappearance, and a visit from the FBI throws the Soprano organisation into upheaval.

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Tony receives a retirement request from one of his associates, and decides to share his recent windfall with Carmela. Later, he is taken on a backyard treasure hunt by Junior, while Hesh seeks revenge against a wrongdoing involving his son-in-law. Starring James Gandolfini.

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: A comatose Tony dreams about being a businessman on a trip marred by mistaken identities, while Carmela and Meadow hold a vigil at his hospital bedside. Silvio takes charge of things at Eugene's funeral in his boss's absence, and Junior is questioned over the shooting.

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Arya continues her training at the House of Black and White, Jorah and Tyrion run into slavers and the Sand Snakes mount an attack. Fantasy, starring Peter Dinklage.

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Jon prepares for conflict, Sansa tries to talk to Theon, and Brienne waits for a sign. Elsewhere, Jaime attempts to reconnect with his family.

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Arya makes progress in her training, Sansa confronts an old friend, Cersei faces a struggle and Jon embarks on a journey. Fantasy drama, starring Lena Headey.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz with a difference, and is joined by comedians Ronni Ancona, Dave Gorman and Lee Mack, plus regular panellist Alan Davies. He asks questions on the theme of all things infantile, and awards points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry presents a festive special of the comedy quiz from 2011, with actor and explorer Brian Blessed and comedians Sean Lock and Ross Noble joining regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of ice.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell is joined by comic actor Greg Davies and TV presenter Konnie Huq, while Lee Mack teams up with former cricketer Phil Tufnell and comedian Marcus Brigstocke, as the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon continues.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: Romesh heads to more countries that are rarely visited by tourists to get a sense of the local culture and find out if they deserve their reputation. In this first edition, he heads to Zimbabwe in the aftermath of Robert Mugabe's rule, to discover whether British people should be holidaying in the southern African country once again. He meets Chipo, a teacher who was born and raised in Harare under Mugabe's rule. She explains that although people have been coming to the country, few venture beyond Victoria Falls. She wants to show Rom what they are missing on a grand, epic road trip that takes in National Parks and close-up encounters with rhinos, elephants and the so-called `cheetah ambassador'.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA
programme.desc: Emily Bett Rickards guests on the classic improv show, hosted by Aisha Tyler.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a museum in Louisiana dedicated to Bonnie and Clyde, and examine a roadie's collection of valuable rock memorabilia.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: As well as Heavy D, Nat has to deal with some voodoo magic, which all proves too much for her. Thankfully auctioneer Sean Kelly is on hand with an emergency vehicle.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Barry, Darren and Scotty get up front and personal, while Boudicca and Linda go nose to nose over an uplifting prize. Meanwhile, John gives Nat a hard time for blind bidding.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys find a replica spaceship during a picking trip in Louisiana, and Mike employs some new negotiating tactics to get a suitable price.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are presented with a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity in Texas and also uncover a stash that includes a meteorite.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: As well as Heavy D, Nat has to deal with some voodoo magic, which all proves too much for her. Thankfully auctioneer Sean Kelly is on hand with an emergency vehicle.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Barry, Darren and Scotty get up front and personal, while Boudicca and Linda go nose to nose over an uplifting prize. Meanwhile, John gives Nat a hard time for blind bidding.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May attempt to improve the ambulance, with the presenters all going their own separate ways to enhance one area they think could do with an overhaul. James focuses on passenger comfort, Richard tries to shorten response times by getting other drivers out of the way more effectively, an issue Jeremy tackles with the invention of what he calls the `sports ambulance'. Their three very different creations are then put to the test with a series of severe and often messy challenges. Plus, Formula One driver Daniel Ricciardo is the Star in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tests the new BMW M4 at the track, before switching to the German manufacturer's hybrid-powered i8 for a trip up the A1 to Whitby, North Yorkshire, where he decides which of the two he would rather take for the drive home. With Land Rover production ceasing in the UK later this year, Richard Hammond pays tribute to the 4x4 by attempting to drive one straight up the side of a dam, while James May puts the Mercedes AMG GT through its paces. Taking to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car are Will Smith and Margot Robbie.

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits the town of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, where he learns the art of temple cooking and samples south Indian dish sambar. He then takes a road trip across the Western Ghats to the state of Kerala, where he prepares regional dessert payasam and a traditional pork curry.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May encounter artillery shells, corsets and classic hot hatchbacks as they take a nostalgic look at French company Peugeot, while Richard Hammond is at the test track to compare the Porsche Cayman GTS with the latest Chevrolet Corvette. James also takes the 950bhp LaFerrari hybrid hypercar out for a spin in Italy, and singer Olly Murs is the Star in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond is dropped into the remote, frozen wastes of Canada to test a watch with a built-in emergency beacon. The distress signal is sent directly to Jeremy Clarkson and James May, who get their hands on two machines and set off on an epic adventure to find their colleague. Plus, Jeremy puts the new 471bhp Lexus RC F coupe thought its paces, while The Fall and The X-Files star Gillian Anderson takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The five comics go undercover as they try to impress Greg Davies with their attempts at high-level espionage.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA
programme.desc: Aisha Tyler hosts the classic improv show, with regulars Wayne Brady , Jonathan Mangum, Colin Mochrie and Ryan Stiles.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway? USA
programme.desc: Improv comedy show with Colin Mochrie, Ryan Stiles, Jeff Davis, Brad Sherwood and Aisha Tyler and a special appearance by Cheryl Hines.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by birdwatcher Bill Oddie and comedians Frank Skinner, Jon Richardson and Sarah Millican on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry presents an edition of the show celebrating the Cultural Olympiad, asking Bill Bailey, David Mitchell, Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies questions about playwright William Shakespeare.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz with a difference, joined by comedians Ross Noble and Dara O Briain, Top Gear's Jeremy Clarkson and regular panellist Alan Davies. He asks questions on the subject of idleness, and awards points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister loses Rimmer in a game of poker to a group of biologically engineered life forms, while Kryten and Cat become quantum entangled and do everything in perfect unison. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister experiences romantic difficulties when he receives a letter from an ex-lover, and finds himself in a love triangle between Snack Dispensers 23 and 34. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The Dwarfers face disaster when they are surrounded by a Simulant Death Ship and a fleet of Annihilators while hiding in an asteroid, and it is up to Arnold J Rimmer to save them. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Zoe Lyons on the topical comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on the week's major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games. From 2014.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef journeys along the Etang de Thau, famous for its oysters and mussels, before mooring his barge in the port of Sete, where Bastille Day is being celebrated. He also rustles up seafood ragout and roast black bream before travelling on to Marseille to tackle the most famous fish dish of all - bouillabaisse.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's epic journey from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean comes to an end as he takes the final leg of his gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France. Arriving in Marseille, he samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as showing a variety of traditional recipes. He also cooks roast black bream and finds time to send Chalky a postcard.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May encounter artillery shells, corsets and classic hot hatchbacks as they take a nostalgic look at French company Peugeot, while Richard Hammond is at the test track to compare the Porsche Cayman GTS with the latest Chevrolet Corvette. James also takes the 950bhp LaFerrari hybrid hypercar out for a spin in Italy, and singer Olly Murs is the Star in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is torn when he comes across a 100-year-old motorbike that he desperately wants, but which he knows is overpriced.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike bids for a 1940s motorcycle, while Danielle gets excited over a gun appraisal.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi and his team work on a high-performance BMW 330, the Interceptor, while a shortage of staff sees Dave manning the phones.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May straps into a highly tuned hatchback as he competes in a world rallycross race, with Top Gear USA host and professional driver Tanner Foust teaming up with him. Jeremy Clarkson puts the latest Jaguar F-type R and Eagle's modernised E-type the Low Drag GT though their paces, while Richard Hammond is in Spain to test the new version of the Mazda MX-5. Plus, X-Men: First Class star Nicholas Hoult takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness travel to Ethiopia, where they test cars to see how they can endure in the searing heat. Back at the track, Chris puts the Ferrari 488 Pista and McLaren 600LT through their paces.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are trying to make the family healthier, so they are not too happy about the school lollipop man handing out sweets to the kids. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. But it turns out there's a whole lot more to this OAP than cardigans and toffees when she tells him how she used to be an international jewel thief - and when she admits there was one heist she never quite managed in her heyday, the pair set out on a criminal adventure. Julia McKenzie stars as the shady senior citizen, with Walliams and Miranda Hart as the boys' ballroom-dancing parents, alongside Joanna Lumley, Rob Brydon and Robbie Williams, with Reece Buttery as Ben.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on expeditions through some of Britain's most historic landscapes in search of the richest stories from the nation's past. He begins with a 40-mile walk along the Derwent Valley in the Peak District, where the world's industrial revolution was born. En route he visits the sleepy village of Cromford to find out about the work of entrepreneur Richard Arkwright, and stops off at a 900-year-old stately home that has been used as the location for three Jane Eyre films. Brian Blessed also introduces Tony to the joys - and the significance - of the Cromford canal, before this leg of his journey ends in Derby.

programme.desc: Thousands of people around the world claim to have had encounters with creatures unlike any recognised by mainstream science - such as the mothman, chupacabra and Mongolian death worm. The veteran actor considers whether these incredible beings could actually be real.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Perhaps the greatest unexplained mystery of all is what happens after death. Clues to the answer may lie in unusual cases of near-death experience, reincarnation, and how memories can be passed from organ donors to transplant recipients. The veteran actor considers if these phenomena are figments of man's collective imagination or whether they could be real.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: Even after centuries of study, the human mind remains as inscrutable as ever. Here, the host considers the abilities of the brain, and whether it may be even more powerful than hitherto realised. He also contemplates the notion that remote viewing - the practice of seeking impressions about a distant object using extrasensory perception - will one day become reality.

programme.title: The UnXplained with William Shatner
programme.desc: An exploration of subjects that have mystified mankind for centuries, with the host shedding light on how the seemingly impossible can sometimes happen. Here, the veteran actor reflects on some remarkable tales of human survival against all the odds. Do such events reveal that humans have a hidden reserve of inexplicable energy locked away that only gets released when the situation calls for it?

programme.title: Ancient Discoveries
programme.desc: Experts discover how an ancient army fought its way through a seven-mile fleet without losing a single ship, and investigate the mystery of a time-travelling vessel. Series exploring the remarkably advanced technology of the ancient world, focusing on how modern discoveries owe much to the scientists and inventors of the past.

programme.title: Ancient Discoveries
programme.desc: Experts examine a bizarre cannon able to kill tens of men without hitting them, and investigate how a bamboo tube became the first gun. Series exploring the remarkably advanced technology of the ancient world, focusing on how modern discoveries owe much to the scientists and inventors of the past.

programme.title: Roman Vice
programme.desc: A fascinating insight into Roman society - a culture where the man of the house traditionally held absolute authority over the rest of the family in a time when decadence was a way of life. Plus, a look at the empire's rulers, including Nero and Augustus, and their claims of divine status.

programme.title: Deadliest Warrior

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Hodgins becomes the prime suspect in a murder case when the body of a woman he held a grudge against is found just metres away from him at a forensic science convention. Meanwhile, Wendall returns to the institute with news about his cancer diagnosis, but when he goes missing following a routine check-up, he gives everyone further cause for concern.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The murder of a maid has a profound effect on Aubrey when the case exposes something much bigger than he and Booth could have imagined. With evidence suggesting the victim arrived in the US illegally, the investigation leads to a house where numerous women are being kept as slaves. Meanwhile, Cam intervenes when Brennan turns down Arastoo's dissertation proposal, causing the intern to talk seriously with Cam about the future of their relationship.

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and Jane investigate when the body of a missing research student is discovered in a tank of flesh-eating insects at a natural history museum. The pair believe the woman was murdered by one of her fellow academics following her pioneering discovery of a new moth species - an accolade they suspect the culprit wanted to claim as their own. Drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team looks into a raid on a naval base, and Dr Cyril Taft - the surgeon who saved Gibbs' life - experiences the thrill of assisting on an investigation. Assigned to treat Gibbs' suspect, Taft manages to uncover evidence that may prove crucial to solving the case. Meanwhile, DiNozzo pays his old flame Jeanne Benoit a visit as he chases a lead involving doctors in Sudan. Guest starring John Cryer and Scottie Thompson.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The TAC team must formulate a new defence strategy after discovering a jury has a subconscious gender bias against a female pilot accused of negligence after a crash.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A gory discovery under a playground roundabout presents the team with a challenging reconstruction task. Investigating the murder of a young financial trader, Booth and Aubrey focus on a wealthy hedge fund, uncovering a world rife with drugs, escorts, incriminating evidence and multimillion-dollar mistakes. The case dredges up painful memories for Aubrey, while competitive intern Oliver Wells gets under Brennan's skin.

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon, Jane and the team investigate when a rich, elderly woman's charred remains are found on the floor of a room in her mansion. They find the list of suspects is quite lengthy, including a nephew who was suing her in order to take control of the family fortune, a doctor who was overprescribing her pain medication and an alcoholic acquaintance at a war veteran's home. Jane, though, has a feeling that something about this case hasn't been right from the start.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A day spent working on a cut-and-dried case leaves the team free to spend some time away from work, and while McGee and Delilah argue over the importance of keeping shop-talk to a minimum, DiNozzo ends up boring his dinner date with crime-solving tales. However, the agents' personal plans are all interrupted as, one-by-one, they realise errors have been made in closing their latest investigation. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An American couple are attacked in Iraq, in the very same spot a group of US Special Ops snipers were ambushed six months earlier. Determined to get to the bottom of the case, Gibbs is forced to speak to Aaron Davis, the only survivor of the first assault, who is now struggling through PTSD at the Walter Reed Medical Centre. The 300th episode of the military crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.

Meanwhile, Jane begins to investigate the murder of up-and-coming model Charlotte Coates, whose body was found outside the rehab centre she was attending. He soon unearths two prime suspects in the form of a fellow patient and Charlotte's counsellor. Drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.

Drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.

programme.desc: Brennan's theories about the Ghost Killer start to gain traction following the discovery of a young heiress's body bearing the murderer's signature. Upon noticing the missing fingernail, Cam bars Brennan from the case, knowing she won't be objective, bringing in Dr Clark to oversee instead. But the scientist can't keep away - and unearths an unexpected link to another incident, as well as a secret that has huge ramifications.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Sweets ruffles Brennan's feathers when he takes Booth's place in an investigation into a murdered swimming coach who had a secret after-hours career. Meanwhile, competitive new intern Jessica (Laura Spencer, The Big Bang Theory) seems more interested in checking out her colleagues than examining evidence.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth's excitement about the possibility of moving to Berlin is dampened by a mysterious phone call offering information on an important case. However, the caller is found dead before the agent is able to get to him, and when the victim is identified as a conspiracy blogger who had been working undercover as a janitor at a security company, his murder indicates he was on to something. As Booth investigates, he encounters secretive judges and obstructive procedures, so decides to branch out on his own to learn if there's something sinister going on inside the FBI - but the situation takes a dangerous turn. David Boreanaz directs and stars.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The long-running crime drama returns with Booth languishing in prison, having been wrongly charged with the murders of three colleagues. Surrounded by cons he helped put behind bars, the agent tries to keep his spirits up, while Brennan and the team work tirelessly to exonerate him. Meanwhile, Sweets and Daisy announce they are going to have a baby.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Kyle Friedgen is accused of killing his ex-girlfriend, but while his case is dismissed due to a mishandled warrant, his life and reputation are marred by suspicion that he got away with murder. Determined to clear his name in full, Friedgen volunteers to be court-martialled, on the condition that the NCIS team conducts its own investigation. Meanwhile, Bishop and Jake discuss their marital problems. Naval crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham, with Jamie Bamber.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The two Marine brothers of a sailor battling leukaemia are killed in the line of duty, and to spare the servicemen's family further grief, the secretary of the US Navy seeks the NCIS team's help in locating a suitable bone marrow donor. Meanwhile, Bishop returns home to Oklahoma for Thanksgiving. Military crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky is assaulted by a man who claims to have previously undisclosed information about his half-brother, who died decades ago. While his NCIS colleagues traces the attacker's whereabouts, Dr Mallard recalls the emotional final days he spent with his sibling. Elsewhere, as the holiday season approaches, Bishop and Jake discuss the future of their relationship. Naval crime drama, starring David McCallum.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The first instalment of a two-part crossover with NCIS: New Orleans sees the Washington, DC team co-operating with their colleagues from the Big Easy to investigate a spate of lethal poisonings on board a New Orleans-to-DC flight. All the evidence seems to point to missing chef Luca, who happens to be Abby's brother, so the two investigative services join forces to locate him, and find out why a private tech firm seems to have been targetted by the killer. Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects foul play when a seaman who was set to testify before a grand jury dies before he can make his court appearance. When it becomes clear the man was murdered, the subsequent investigation reveals that a previously thwarted human-trafficking ring has been re-established. Meanwhile, a storm causes a massive power outage, and McGee seeks a room for the night among his colleagues. Naval crime drama, starring Sean Murray.

programme.desc: Rio comes up with a plan when Sierra confesses something big on her wedding day. Mike and Rudy devise a plan to make money from the New Yorkers who are coming in for the wedding, while Beau and Kay find themselves at a crossroads.

programme.title: Damien
programme.desc: The photographer gets help from a surprising source as Shay locates Damien's old friend. A mysterious figure asks for Simone's help, and Rutledge makes an intriguing offer.

programme.title: The Walking Dead
programme.desc: What starts out as a possible mending adventure for Daryl and Carol turns sideways when they come across an old cabin. that takes Daryl back to his years away from the group after Rick disappeared. He relives the painful memory of meeting a reticent survivor and the toxic events that amplified his relationship with Dog. Norman Reedus and Melissa McBride star.

programme.desc: Peter discovers that he has a vestigial twin growing out of his neck and names him Chip. However, he soon becomes jealous of the attention the new arrival is receiving and decides to try to amputate his brother. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.

programme.desc: Quagmire finally meets a woman with a sexual appetite as insatiable as his, but things take a turn for the worse when she makes him her sex slave. Meanwhile, a love triangle emerges between Stewie, Brian and Stewie's teddy bear, Rupert.

programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a Jaguar Mark 2 - but is later left to reflect whether the purchase has been a wise one as mechanic Edd China reports a list of serious defects.

programme.desc: Bruce Crompton acquires an extremely rare - and valuable - German Panther tank - and its original undercoat is more pink than camouflage. However, getting parts is a struggle.

programme.desc: Matt, Arran and Paul move a giant crane bound for a wind turbine factory over icy roads. Plus, Simon and Sam attempt to move a demolition excavator but are halted by road works.

programme.desc: The team takes on one of Europe's fastest growing car markets, visiting Albania to convert a vintage saloon into an off-road beast.

programme.desc: How the world's largest passenger airliner - the A380 - is serviced, and the process of building and tuning a piano to concert standards.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team takes on a pocket-sized racing car, a century-old weather vane, and a much loved but horribly damaged leather rhinoceros.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: At Biggin Hill, south-east London, military equipment collector Bruce Crompton views a collector's haul of Second World War Spitfires. Plus, the twins prepare some wartime artillery guns to export to Australia - but it's no easy feat.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Three British farmers try to run three very different family farms, revealing the challenges and rewards that come with making a living off the land.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard searches the UK for valuable scrap items. He tries to make a profit on a collection of 19th-century balconet rails, finds himself bartering with a baronet at one of Scotland's grandest estates and is given a run for his money by a seasoned salvager.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: A violent summer storm sees the Young Guns race to save their only claim from a flood. Former trucker Chris arrives in Lightning Ridge, desperate to make a fortune in opal.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a Jaguar Mark 2 - but is later left to reflect whether the purchase has been a wise one as mechanic Edd China reports a list of serious defects.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit a Yorkshire textile mill, where Simon repurposes a mill trolley into a coffee table and Henry struggles to repair a Soviet-era motorbike.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: iDrew Pritchard hts the road with upholsterer Craig. In Derbyshire a 15th-century house has some Victorian dining chairs with potential, and the duo also visit an antique centre in Lincolnshire.

programme.title: Curse of the Bermuda Triangle
programme.desc: Documentary series examining the mysteries surrounding the Bermuda Triangle. The team investigates evidence of an alien encounter in the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: Jeremy Wade's Dark Waters
programme.desc: Jeremy travels to Alaska to discover what has happened to the king salmon, a search that takes him from the state's most heavily fished rivers to the mighty Yukon River.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How platinum cleans exhaust fumes, and the technology that enabled the construction of a space station 360km above Earth.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The requirements that must be met to transform a family car into a rally car. Plus, the manufacture of titanium, the metal that the modern aerospace industry relies on.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to America in search of a Willys Jeep, but the vehicle he finds needs major repairs and high transport costs to the UK could jeopardise his making a profit.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: At Biggin Hill, south-east London, military equipment collector Bruce Crompton views a collector's haul of Second World War Spitfires. Plus, the twins prepare some wartime artillery guns to export to Australia - but it's no easy feat.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a complex hybrid chopper for an electrics company, and the rift within the Teutul family continues when Paul Sr angrily returns a motorcycle to his son.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: The firm stands to attention with two huge military moves - which include shifting 17 armoured vehicles from Salisbury Plain to the biggest British army base in the world.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: The MV Resolution, a unique ship designed with six mechanical legs enabling it to lift itself 10 metres out of the sea to assist in the installation of wind turbines.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The technology behind high-precision cutting tools, stained glass and recorders, and how production methods have advanced over time.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The methods used to make conga drums, metal plating and buttons, and how they have evolved over the years.

programme.title: Mega Shippers
programme.desc: Documentary profiling the workers responsible for keeping the world's cargo ships on the move 365 days a year. In Southampton dock, Pete Lavelle races to load 750 luxury cars worth over £25million onto Titania, one of the largest vessel carriers in the world.

programme.title: Mighty Trains
programme.desc: The Canadian, VIA Rail's iconic passenger train, which travels between Vancouver's Central Station and Toronto's Union Station on a four-day, four-night journey.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer logs on to an online auction searching for a cheap Suzuki in need of repair. He soon finds an SJ410 and hands the vehicle over to mechanic Edd China for restoration.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The work on the Suzuki continues as Edd China gives it a new interior, paint job and roll cage, aiming to make a tidy profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China gets to work transforming an old Mazda MX5, removing the leaking roof, rusty wings and seats.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The air filter, chassis brace and wheels of the Mazda MX5 are fixed, and the new roof is fitted before Mike Brewer takes the completed car for a test drive.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer plans to capitalise on 1980s nostalgia by restoring an original 1982 Toyota Supra, and Ant Anstead works to bring this 35-year-old car into the modern era.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer hopes to tap into 1990s nostalgia by working on an 1994 Mitsubishi 3000GT VR-4, but restoring the vehicle to its original state proves harder than expected.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds and restores a classic 1985 MK1 Mazda RX7, which has unstable after-market add-ons and a dubious rotary engine.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a clean Subaru Impreza WRX at a good price, and hands it to Edd China to make it stand out by giving it a performance boost and changing its appearance.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China take on their first Honda, but finding a cheap S2000 is hard and Mike gambles on a car that has already had more than £4,000 spent on it.

programme.title: Disasters Engineered
programme.desc: Experts examine the devastating collapse of the Rana Plaza factory in Bangladesh and of the Morandi bridge in Genoa, Italy, and ask if these disasters could have been avoided.

programme.title: Curse of the Bermuda Triangle
programme.desc: Documentary series examining the mysteries surrounding the Bermuda Triangle. The team investigates evidence of an alien encounter in the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Chris Cheal's dream of two mining teams struggles to launch. Meanwhile, the Blacklighters gamble on a new claim to break a month-long opal drought.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike gets his hands dirty working on a Ford Bronco for the biggest collector car auction in the world, Barrett Jackson.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard Drew and Tee John visit a 500-year-old copper mine in the village of Coniston, Cumbria. They uncover a slipware dairy bowl, pattern wheels and a retail counter.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard finally opens his own antiques shop in his home town of Conwy, so goes to the Cotswolds and one of the UK's largest indoor antiques, looking for treasure.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Luton Town v Swansea City, Middlesbrough v Stoke City and Bournemouth v Barnsley.

programme.title: Curse of the Bermuda Triangle
programme.desc: Documentary series examining the mysteries surrounding the Bermuda Triangle. The team investigates evidence of an alien encounter in the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: Resident Evil: Damnation
programme.desc: Animated action horror based on the video-game series. A special agent investigates the use of biological weapons in a European civil war.

programme.title: The Bouncer
programme.desc: An imprisoned bodyguard in his 50s is forced to work with the police and infiltrate the organisation of a dangerous Flemish gang leader to secure his freedom and the custody of his eight-year-old daughter. Action thriller, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Sami Bouajila and Sveva Alviti. In French.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: A look at all the films coming to Sky Cinema in March.

programme.title: Hell on the Border
programme.desc: After shooting five men to save a judge and then going into Indian Territory after a lethal outlaw, Bass Reeves becomes the first black deputy marshal west of Mississippi. As he heads deeper into the Cherokee Nation, Reeves must not only dodge bullets, but severe discrimination in hopes of earning his star - and cement his place as a cowboy legend. Western, starring David Gyasi, Ron Perlman and Frank Grillo.

programme.title: Street Fighter
programme.desc: Action adventure starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Raul Julia and featuring Kylie Minogue. With 63 relief workers held hostage under threat of execution, crazed dictator General Bison faces attack from Colonel Guile and the Allied Nations' peace-keeping force. Meanwhile, TV journalist Chun-Li's attempts to report on the action form a cover for her own private vendetta against Bison.

programme.title: Star Wars Episode IX: the Rise of Skywalker
programme.desc: Rey and the surviving members of the resistance face the evil First Order once more as the conflict between the Jedi and the Sith reaches its peak, bringing the Skywalker saga to its close. The Force Awakens' JJ Abrams returns to the director's chair, with many of the cast from the old and new fantasy saga reprising their roles, including Daisy Ridley, Adam Driver, Oscar Isaac, Ian McDiarmid, John Boyega, Anthony Daniels, Billy Dee Williams and Carrie Fisher.

programme.title: Terminator: Dark Fate
programme.desc: An augmented human and Sarah Connor must stop an advanced liquid Terminator named Rev-9 from hunting down a young girl in Mexico City, whose fate is critical to the human race. As the Rev-9 ruthlessly destroys everything and everyone in its path, the three are led to a T-800 from Sarah's past that may be their last best hope. Sci-fi adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton and Mackenzie Davis.

programme.title: Cliffhanger
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Sylvester Stallone and John Lithgow. Former mountain-rescue climber Gabe Walker is persuaded to come out of retirement to help answer a distress call from a plane that has crash-landed. When he and fellow rescuer Hal Tucker reach the crash site, they discover the passengers are members of a criminal gang who want Walker and Tucker to help retrieve their stolen money.

programme.title: Street Fighter
programme.desc: Action adventure starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Raul Julia and featuring Kylie Minogue. With 63 relief workers held hostage under threat of execution, crazed dictator General Bison faces attack from Colonel Guile and the Allied Nations' peace-keeping force. Meanwhile, TV journalist Chun-Li's attempts to report on the action form a cover for her own private vendetta against Bison.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: Whistleblower Elena Houghlin has evidence that the Calisto energy conservation project can be hacked for nefarious means. Former MI6 agent Jane Kano and heiress jailbird Sabina Wilson intervene to save Elena from an assassin and attempt to steal the remaining Calisto devices before they can be weaponised. Comedy thriller inspired by the TV series, starring Kristen Stewart, Ella Balinska, Naomi Scott and Elizabeth Banks, who also wrote and directed.

programme.title: Star Wars Episode IX: the Rise of Skywalker
programme.desc: Rey and the surviving members of the resistance face the evil First Order once more as the conflict between the Jedi and the Sith reaches its peak, bringing the Skywalker saga to its close. Western, starring David Gyasi, Ron Perlman and Frank Grillo.

programme.title: The Hurricane Heist
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Maggie Grace and Toby Kebbell. With a category 5 hurricane bearing down on an Alabama town, an opportunistic group of crooks use the meteorological mayhem as cover for an audacious raid on a US Treasury facility. However, standing in the criminals' way are a maverick ATF agent and a stormchaser with a tragic past.

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Action adventure starring Nicolas Cage as Benjamin Franklin Gates, whose family has been charged with protecting a fabulous treasure trove hidden by the Founding Fathers of America, the whereabouts of which can only be discovered by decoding an elaborate series of ciphers. When Benjamin uncovers a plot to steal the treasure, he embarks on a desperate mission to find it before it falls into the wrong hands.

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Fantasy action adventure based on the Marvel comic, starring Tobey Maguire, Willem Dafoe and Kirsten Dunst. During a school trip to a New York laboratory, Peter Parker is bitten by a genetically modified spider and develops extraordinary powers. Then a series of events convinces Peter that he should use his new physical abilities to wage war on crime - a decision that takes him away from his school sweetheart, Mary Jane Watson, and pits him against the evil Green Goblin. \n.

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Superhero action adventure starring Henry Cavill and Ben Affleck. After an international incident makes the US government distrustful of Superman, Batman takes it upon himself to find a way to stop the man of steel. But is the growing conflict all a part of villainous businessman Lex Luthor's master plan? And can Lois Lane get to the bottom of the scheme in time?

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Keanu Reeves, Dennis Hopper and Sandra Bullock. A demented extortionist's plan to collect a huge ransom by planting a bomb in an LA skyscraper is thwarted by the reckless bravery of SWAT daredevil Jack Traven. Undeterred, the unhinged bomber sets Traven a sterner test - an even more deadly device on board a commuter-filled bus that will explode if the bus's speed drops below 50mph.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: Whistleblower Elena Houghlin has evidence that the Calisto energy conservation project can be hacked for nefarious means. Former MI6 agent Jane Kano and heiress jailbird Sabina Wilson intervene to save Elena from an assassin and attempt to steal the remaining Calisto devices before they can be weaponised. Comedy thriller inspired by the TV series, starring Kristen Stewart, Ella Balinska, Naomi Scott and Elizabeth Banks, who also wrote and directed.

But is the growing conflict all a part of villainous businessman Lex Luthor's master plan? And can Lois Lane get to the bottom of the scheme in time?

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: Futuristic action adventure starring Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron. In a world where water is precious and humanity faces extinction, a one-armed woman takes off across the desert with a lorry-load of females who've been imprisoned to bear children. Riding shotgun is Max, the infamous 'Road Warrior'.

programme.title: Love Sarah
programme.desc: A young woman enlists the help of her an old friend and her grandma as she sets out to fulfil her mother's dream and open a bakery in Notting Hill, London. Director Eliza Schroeder's comedy drama, starring Celia Imrie, Rupert Penry-Jones, Bill Paterson, and former Great British Bake Off winner Candice Brown.

programme.title: EuroTrip
programme.desc: Comedy starring Scott Mechlowicz, Michelle Trachtenberg and Jacob Pitts. An American high-school student embarks on a trip across Europe with his friends to meet the buxom German blonde with whom he's been corresponding via the internet.

programme.title: Short Circuit 2
programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring Fisher Stevens. Robotics engineer Ben Jahrvi sets up a toy factory after accepting an order for 1,000 replicas of Number Five, the military robot he co-created. But when Number Five, now known as Johnny Five, arrives to run the factory, he is deceived by a gang of criminals.

programme.title: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Comedy starring Kristen Wiig and Rose Byrne. When Lillian announces her engagement she can't wait to share the happiest day of her life with her girlfriends. But plans for the bachelorette party descend into chaos when war breaks out between needy maid of honour Annie and control freak Helen.

programme.title: Happiest Season
programme.desc: A woman heads to girlfriend's family home for Christmas, but discovers she hasn't come out to her conservative parents. That throws a spanner in the works when it comes to her plans to propose. Romantic comedy, starring Kristen Stewart, Mackenzie Davis, Alison Brie, and Clea DuVall, who also wrote and directed.

programme.title: Team America: World Police
programme.desc: Satirical comedy co-written, directed by and featuring the voices of South Park creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone, and performed by Thunderbirds-style puppets. A counter-terrorism squad causes havoc as it does battle with the Film Actors Guild and North Korean dictator Kim Jong Il, who is bent on destroying the civilised world.

programme.title: The Hot Chick
programme.desc: Body-swap comedy starring Rob Schneider. After shoplifting a pair of cursed African earrings, beautiful but mean teenager Jessica Spencer wakes up inside the body of shabby 30-something thief Clive - just days before a crucial cheerleading contest and her senior prom.

programme.title: She's in Portland
programme.desc: Wes is a wealthy banker living in a great house with an adolescent daughter and pregnant wife. Hoping to reconnect with his college friend, Luke, now an unhappy music video editor, Wes drags him along on a road trip to Portland, Oregon. Co-writer/director Marc Carlini's comedy drama, starring Tommy Dewey, Francois Arnaud and Minka Kelly.

programme.title: Fun with Dick and Jane
programme.desc: Comedy starring Jim Carrey and Téa Leoni as successful suburban couple Dick and Jane Harper. When Dick loses his job after being made the scapegoat for financial irregularities within his firm, he and his wife realise that the only way to maintain their affluent lifestyle is to turn to crime.\n.

programme.title: Happiest Season
programme.desc: A woman heads to girlfriend's family home for Christmas, but discovers she hasn't come out to her conservative parents. That throws a spanner in the works when it comes to her plans to propose. Romantic comedy, starring Kristen Stewart, Mackenzie Davis, Alison Brie, and Clea DuVall, who also wrote and directed.

programme.title: Alan Partridge: Alpha Papa
programme.desc: Comedy starring Steve Coogan. Norwich DJ Alan Partridge is unconcerned when his local radio station, North Norfolk Digital, is bought out by a multinational. But when he finds out that it's either himself or fellow DJ Pat Farrell who must go, Alan makes sure that it's his colleague who gets the boot. However, when a shotgun-wielding Farrell decides to hold the staff hostage, it's up to Norwich's most famous son to save the day.

programme.title: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Comedy starring Kristen Wiig and Rose Byrne. When Lillian announces her engagement she can't wait to share the happiest day of her life with her girlfriends. But plans for the bachelorette party descend into chaos when war breaks out between needy maid of honour Annie and control freak Helen.

When Dick loses his job after being made the scapegoat for financial irregularities within his firm, he and his wife realise that the only way to maintain their affluent lifestyle is to turn to crime.\n.

programme.title: Three Men and a Baby
programme.desc: Comedy starring Tom Selleck, Steve Guttenberg and Ted Danson as three confirmed bachelors, who learn parenting skills the hard way when an abandoned baby turns up on their doorstep.

programme.title: About Time
programme.desc: Romantic sci-fi comedy starring Domhnall Gleeson, Rachel McAdams and Bill Nighy. When Tim turns 21, his father reveals that the men in their family have a supernatural power: they can travel through time. Tim decides to use his gift and improve his life - by finding a girlfriend.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor
programme.desc: Comedy starring Eddie Murphy as both Sherman Klump - the amiable, portly science teacher - and Buddy Love - his sleek, sharp alter ego. After being humiliated on a date, Klump decides to try out the weight-loss formula he has been perfecting. He is transformed into Buddy Love who, while half Klump's size, is also mean and aggressive.

programme.title: Clue
programme.desc: Comedy, based on the board game Cluedo, starring Tim Curry, Madeline Kahn and Christopher Lloyd. Six strange people arriving at an isolated mansion are given pseudonyms by the mysterious butler. As the thunder claps and the lightning flashes, members of the household begin to be found dead. So who is the victim, who is the murderer, and where was the deed done?

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
programme.desc: Romantic comedy adapted from the bestselling novel by Helen Fielding, starring Renée Zellweger, Colin Firth and Hugh Grant. Weight-obsessed 30-something Bridget Jones is busy lamenting her lack of a good man when two come along at once: her flirtatious boss Daniel Cleaver and uptight childhood friend Mark Darcy. Unfortunately, in typical world-of-Bridget style, the two men have met before, and she finds herself thrust from being a wallflower to the centre of a bizarre love triangle.

programme.title: Bridget Jones: the Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Romantic comedy sequel starring Renée Zellweger, Hugh Grant and Colin Firth. When Bridget discovers her seemingly perfect barrister boyfriend Mark Darcy has unattractive qualities that she'd previously overlooked, she finds herself drawn once again to the dastardly Daniel Cleaver.

programme.title: The Unicorn
programme.desc: Mallory and Caleb have been engaged for four years, there's no wedding date in sight, and their love life has grown stale. They decide to breathe new life into their relationship by having a threesome, but will it cause more problems than it solves? Director Robert Schwartzman's comedy, starring Lucy Hale, Lauren Lapkus and Nicholas Rutherford.

programme.title: About Time
programme.desc: Romantic sci-fi comedy starring Domhnall Gleeson, Rachel McAdams and Bill Nighy. When Tim turns 21, his father reveals that the men in their family have a supernatural power: they can travel through time. Tim decides to use his gift and improve his life - by finding a girlfriend.
