programme.title: The Bay of Silence
programme.desc: Will believes his wife Rosalind is innocent of their son's suspected murder, only to discover the devastating truth behind her past links to another unsolved crime. Director Paula van der Oest's thriller, starring Claes Bang, Olga Kurylenko, Brian Cox and Caroline Goodall, who also adapted Lisa St Aubin de Teran's source novel.

programme.title: Single White Female
programme.desc: Thriller starring Bridget Fonda and Jennifer Jason Leigh. Successful computer programmer Allison Jones advertises for a flatmate after breaking up with her boyfriend. She finally chooses Hedra Carlson, a reserved young woman whose initial friendship with Allison begins to transform into a disturbing fixation.

programme.title: Surveillance
programme.desc: Two FBI agents on the trail of a serial killer head to a police station in the middle of the Sante Fe desert to quiz three survivors of a brutal attack which saw five people slain. However, as they quiz the eyewitnesses and emerge with different versions of the same event, it becomes apparent that all is not what it seems. Thriller, with Julia Ormond, Bill Pullman, Pell James, Ryan Simpkins and French Stewart.

programme.title: Crypto
programme.desc: Young Wall Street banker Martin Duran hasn't been back to his home town since his mother's death a decade earlier. When he annoys his company's CEO, who relegates him to his old stamping ground, Martin has to cope with his estranged family, while dealing with the global cryptocurrency conspiracy he uncovered. Cyber thriller, starring Beau Knapp, Alexis Bledel and Kurt Russell.

programme.title: First Love
programme.desc: Over the course of one night in Tokyo, a young boxer and a call girl get tangled up in a sinister drug-smuggling plot, leading to a rollercoaster evening involving corrupt cops, the Yakuza and a female assassin. Crime drama, starring Sakurako Konishi, Masataka Kubota and Nao Ohmori. In Japanese.

programme.title: Ride
programme.desc: James is a struggling LA actor who moonlights as a cab driver to make ends meet. Though he clicks with his first customer, a pretty young woman named Jessica, his shift takes a dangerous turn when Bruno, a dangerous psychopath, terrorises him and his passenger, forcing them into a battle for survival. Writer/director Jeremy Ungar's thriller, starring Bella Thorne, Jessie T Usher and Will Brill.

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: Thriller starring Matthew Fox, Dennis Quaid and Forest Whitaker. When an assassination attempt is made on the US President after he arrives in Spain for a landmark summit, chaos ensues. Eight strangers, each with different points of view on the event, believe they hold the key to unlocking the truth about the attack.\n.

programme.title: Jackie Brown
programme.desc: Crime thriller starring Pam Grier and Samuel L Jackson. Flight attendant Jackie Brown is arrested for smuggling money and drugs into the country for ruthless arms dealer Ordell Robbie. Realising that Ordell is likely to kill her, Jackie decides to play him and the cops off against each other.

programme.title: The Hummingbird Project
programme.desc: Cousins Vincent and Anton are players in the high-stakes game of high-frequency trading. They want to build a straight fibre-optic cable line between Kansas and New Jersey, making them a fortune and taking them on a daring adventure. Writer/director Kim Nguyen's drama, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Alexander Skarsgard and Salma Hayek.

programme.title: First Love
programme.desc: Over the course of one night in Tokyo, a young boxer and a call girl get tangled up in a sinister drug-smuggling plot, leading to a rollercoaster evening involving corrupt cops, the Yakuza and a female assassin. Crime drama, starring Sakurako Konishi, Masataka Kubota and Nao Ohmori. In Japanese.

Flight attendant Jackie Brown is arrested for smuggling money and drugs into the country for ruthless arms dealer Ordell Robbie. Realising that Ordell is likely to kill her, Jackie decides to play him and the cops off against each other.

programme.title: Training Day
programme.desc: Police drama starring Denzel Washington and Ethan Hawke. Idealistic rookie cop Jake Hoyt is given the opportunity of trying out with an elite Los Angeles undercover narcotics squad. Hoyt joins Detective Sergeant Alonzo Harris for a day working the streets, but quickly realises that his superior's approach to law enforcement is not strictly by the book.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction
programme.desc: Thriller starring Michael Douglas, Glenn Close and Anne Archer. While his wife and daughter are away, Manhattan lawyer Dan Gallagher has a passionate fling with Alex Forrest, an unmarried woman he meets through business. It is an affair that is to have terrifying consequences for Gallagher and his family.

programme.title: Villain
programme.desc: Former criminal Eddie Franks attempts to help his family by reconnecting with his daughter and clearing his brother's debt. Despite his efforts, he is drawn back into a criminal way of life, with devastating consequences. Director Philip Barantini's crime drama, starring Craig Fairbrass, Robert Glenister and George Russo.

programme.title: The Hummingbird Project
programme.desc: Cousins Vincent and Anton are players in the high-stakes game of high-frequency trading. They want to build a straight fibre-optic cable line between Kansas and New Jersey, making them a fortune and taking them on a daring adventure. Writer/director Kim Nguyen's drama, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Alexander Skarsgard and Salma Hayek.

programme.title: Captain Phillips
programme.desc: Drama based on a true story, starring Tom Hanks. A tense stand-off ensues between Captain Richard Phillips and Muse, the leader of Somali pirates who hijack his container ship. But both men are also subjected to outside political forces.

programme.title: Angels & Demons
programme.desc: Mystery thriller based on Dan Brown's forerunner to The Da Vinci Code, starring Tom Hanks and Ayelet Zurer. With the election of a new pope imminent, the Illuminati kidnap the four leading contenders and issue a coded message that they will murder the men and blow up the Vatican. Catholic leaders turn to Harvard symbolist Robert Langdon, who must put his uneasy relationship with the church hierarchy aside in an effort to crack the code and save the men's lives.

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: Action crime thriller from the director of Heat, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx. Suave hitman Vincent hijacks taxi driver Max and forces him to stop at a variety of locations in Los Angeles where he carries out his gruesome business. Realising that his unwilling participation will end with his demise, Max looks for means of escape.\n.

programme.title: 2 Guns
programme.desc: Crime drama starring Denzel Washington and Mark Wahlberg. Two undercover agents working for different organisations are planted in the same criminal gang, unaware of each other's true identity. While getting in each other's way, the danger is that a powerful Mob boss will escape justice.

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 123
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and John Travolta star in this remake of the 1974 thriller. An armed gang holds passengers on a New York subway train hostage, and threatens to start killing them unless they receive a huge ransom. As the minutes tick by, the tense situation becomes a battle of wits between gang leader 'Ryder' and train dispatcher Walter Garber.

programme.title: Captain Phillips
programme.desc: Drama based on a true story, starring Tom Hanks. A tense stand-off ensues between Captain Richard Phillips and Muse, the leader of Somali pirates who hijack his container ship. But both men are also subjected to outside political forces.

programme.title: Angels & Demons
programme.desc: Mystery thriller based on Dan Brown's forerunner to The Da Vinci Code, starring Tom Hanks and Ayelet Zurer. With the election of a new pope imminent, the Illuminati kidnap the four leading contenders and issue a coded message that they will murder the men and blow up the Vatican. Catholic leaders turn to Harvard symbolist Robert Langdon, who must put his uneasy relationship with the church hierarchy aside in an effort to crack the code and save the men's lives.

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: Action crime thriller from the director of Heat, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx. Suave hitman Vincent hijacks taxi driver Max and forces him to stop at a variety of locations in Los Angeles where he carries out his gruesome business. Realising that his unwilling participation will end with his demise, Max looks for means of escape.\n.

programme.title: The Ugly Truth
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Gerard Butler and Katherine Heigl. TV producer Abby Richter is a born romantic despite being unlucky in love. So when her station hires blunt presenter Mike Chadway, who holds a far more cynical view of relationships, it's inevitable that the pair will clash. But is it Mike or Abby who proves to have the correct take on affairs of the heart?

programme.title: Waves
programme.desc: High school student Tyler Williams is a star athlete on the wrestling team thanks to relentless training and sparring with his domineering father, Ronald. Those dreams of excellence are threatened by Tyler's shoulder injury, which he secretly deals with using prescription painkillers. Events spiral out of control when Tyler's girlfriend, Alexis, learns she is pregnant and the young couple run a gauntlet of angry protesters outside an abortion clinic. Writer/director Trey Edward Shults' award winning drama, starring Kelvin Harrison Jr, Lucas Hedges and Taylor Russell.

programme.title: Vita & Virginia
programme.desc: Biopic romance about the life of Virginia Woolf and her passionate love affair with fellow author Vita Sackville-West. The pair meet in London in the 1920s and, despite both of them being married, they embark on an affair that later inspired one of Virginia's novels. Gemma Arterton and Elizabeth Debicki star in the title roles, along with Rupert Penry-Jones and Isabella Rossellini.

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: Adventure drama starring Tom Hanks and Helen Hunt. Workaholic executive Chuck Noland is looking forward to spending Christmas with his girlfriend, but is sent abroad on an assignment at the last minute. When his plane crashes into the Pacific, Chuck is stranded alone on a remote, uninhabited island.

programme.title: Sometimes Always Never
programme.desc: Alan is a tailor whose son Michael stormed out years ago over a game of Scrabble. Alan attempts to fix the relationship with his youngest son Peter, and solve the mystery of an online player who he thinks could be Michael, so he can reunite his family. Writer Frank Cottrell Boyce's comedy drama, starring Bill Nighy, Sam Riley and Alice Lowe.

programme.title: Judy
programme.desc: Judy Garland is embroiled in a tug-of-war with husband Sidney Luft for custody of their children, Lorna and Joey. Crippled by debt, the showbiz legend reluctantly agrees to a run of shows in London. Unfortunately, fiance Mickey Deans continually distracts her when she should be rehearsing. Biopic, starring Oscar and Bafta-winner Renee Zellweger, with Jessie Buckley and Rufus Sewell.

programme.title: Blood Diamond
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Djimon Hounsou and Jennifer Connelly. Sierra Leone during the civil war of the late 1990s: while trying to smuggle diamonds into Liberia, Danny Archer, an ex-mercenary from Zimbabwe, is thrown into prison where he meets fisherman Solomon Vandy, whose son Dia has been conscripted into the guerrilla army. When Archer realises Solomon knows the whereabouts of a priceless blood diamond, he arranges for the pair's release to help the distraught father find his boy. But Archer's motives are not entirely altruistic.

programme.title: Windows on the World
programme.desc: After watching the news on 9/11 with his family, Fernando, a young Mexican man, travels from Mexico to New York City to find his father, an undocumented worker at the World Trade Center's famous Windows on the World restaurant. Director Michael D Olmos's drama, starring (his father) Edward James Olmos, Ryan Guzman, Jacqueline Obradors, and in one of his final films, Rene Auberjonois.

programme.title: Bailey & Darla
programme.desc: After he receives a new cancer diagnosis and she is fired from her job as a sex columnist, hopeless romantic Bailey and cynical writer Darla take a road trip that forces them to get intimate with their issues, as well as each other. Comedy, starring Brittany Snow, Sam Richardson and Anna Akana.

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: Adventure drama starring Tom Hanks and Helen Hunt. Workaholic executive Chuck Noland is looking forward to spending Christmas with his girlfriend, but is sent abroad on an assignment at the last minute. When his plane crashes into the Pacific, Chuck is stranded alone on a remote, uninhabited island.

Comedy, starring Brittany Snow, Sam Richardson and Anna Akana.

Director Michael D Olmos's drama, starring (his father) Edward James Olmos, Ryan Guzman, Jacqueline Obradors, and in one of his final films, Rene Auberjonois.

programme.title: The Runaways
programme.desc: After their home life is turned upside down, three children and the family's donkeys escape across the backbone of northern England, confronting both the harsh landscapes and what it means to be siblings. Drama, starring Mark Addy, Tara Fitzgerald and Molly Windsor.

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc:
Romantic comedy drama based on the novel by Nick Hornby, starring Hugh Grant as womanising 30-something Will. In search of easy conquests, Will poses as a father at a picnic for single parents where he meets the emotionally troubled Fiona and her 12-year-old son, Marcus. 


.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Richard Curtis, writer of Four Weddings and a Funeral and Notting Hill, makes his directorial debut with this ensemble romantic comedy featuring Hugh Grant, Emma Thompson, Laura Linney and Keira Knightley. In London, during the weeks leading up to Christmas, people from various walks of life suffer the emotional highs and lows of being in love. \n.

programme.title: Tolkien
programme.desc: Before going on to write classic fantasy books The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings, orphaned author JRR Tolkien finds friendship, love and artistic inspiration among a group of fellow outcasts at school. Eventually his experiences during the First World War inspire him to create a world of hobbits and wizards. Biopic, starring Nicholas Hoult, Lily Collins, Pam Ferris, Craig Roberts, and Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: Drama based on a true story, starring Oscar-winning Sandra Bullock. The life of homeless and largely abandoned African American teenager Michael Oher seems to be heading nowhere. That is until the intervention of wealthy white housewife Leigh Anne Tuohy, who takes Michael into her family home and helps him fulfil his potential - especially on the football field.

programme.title: Apollo 13
programme.desc: Space drama based on actual events, starring Tom Hanks, Bill Paxton and Kevin Bacon. 1970: Apollo 13's mission to the Moon is hit by disaster when an oxygen tank explodes in the spacecraft. Following the initial damage report, it seems as if there is little hope of the three-man crew, led by Jim Lovell, making it back to Earth.

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc:
Romantic comedy drama based on the novel by Nick Hornby, starring Hugh Grant as womanising 30-something Will. In search of easy conquests, Will poses as a father at a picnic for single parents where he meets the emotionally troubled Fiona and her 12-year-old son, Marcus. 


.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Richard Curtis, writer of Four Weddings and a Funeral and Notting Hill, makes his directorial debut with this ensemble romantic comedy featuring Hugh Grant, Emma Thompson, Laura Linney and Keira Knightley. In London, during the weeks leading up to Christmas, people from various walks of life suffer the emotional highs and lows of being in love. \n.

programme.title: Bugsy
programme.desc: Crime drama, based on the life of gangster Benjamin 'Bugsy' Siegel, starring Warren Beatty and Annette Bening. Arriving in California to take over assorted Los Angeles rackets, Siegel is welcomed by movie star George Raft and quickly becomes captivated by the glamour of the Hollywood film industry. He also meets and develops an obsessional love for starlet Virginia Hill.

programme.title: Problem Child
programme.desc: Comedy starring John Ritter. Seven-year-old Junior is an orphan who, through his fiendish behaviour, has become the 'most returned' inmate of the Brutus Orphanage. Eventually, he is adopted by unsuspecting suburban couple Ben and Flo, but his behaviour remains inventively destructive.

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring John Goodman and Jim Broadbent. Pod, Homily and their children Peagreen and Arietty are the Borrowers, a family of tiny people living secretly in the house of young Pete. When Pete's Great Aunt Mary dies, no one can find the will and it looks as if the house may fall into the hands of nasty local lawyer, Ocious P Potter, and put the little family in danger.

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: A young and ambitious mole wants to become a footballer and save his town's gold mine from greedy super villain The Boss. Director Trevor Hardy's animated adventure, featuring the voices of Ken Stott, Lizzie Waterworth and Alex Kelly.

programme.title: Home Alone: the Holiday Heist
programme.desc: Seasonal comedy starring Christian Martyn and Malcolm McDowell. A boy is convinced his new family home is haunted and tries to capture the Christmas ghost with traps that prove more effective at thwarting a trio of burglars.

programme.title: Paddington 2
programme.desc: Comedy starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins, Hugh Grant and Ben Whishaw as the voice of Paddington. When a rare pop-up book is stolen before Paddington can buy it as a birthday present for his aunt Lucy, the little bear is arrested as the prime suspect in the theft. While Paddington is attempting to make the most of his incarceration, the true thief is using clues hidden in the book to locate the immense fortune of its late author.

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Action adventure sequel starring Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Jon Voight and Helen Mirren. When a stranger informs them that one of their ancestors might have been involved in the plot to assassinate President Lincoln, treasure hunter Ben Gates and his archaeologist father Patrick set out to clear the family name. Their quest takes them to Buckingham Palace and the White House, where they uncover evidence of a lost city of gold.

programme.title: Cats
programme.desc: A tribe of cats called the Jellicles must decide annually which one will ascend to the Heaviside Layer and come back to a new life. Co-writer and director Tom Hooper's adaptation of Andrew Lloyd Webber's hit 1981 musical, featuring classic tracks Memory and Mr Mistoffelees. Starring Judi Dench, James Corden, Idris Elba and Rebel Wilson.

programme.title: The Dark Crystal
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure. A thousand years have passed and a time of change has arrived. Raised by the gentle Mystics, Jen, a young Gelfling, has been chosen to go on a hazardous journey. He must find the shard to heal the magical Dark Crystal. If he fails, the evil Skeksis will rule the world forever.

programme.title: Four Kids and It
programme.desc: Fantasy drama starring Matthew Goode and Paula Patton, and featuring the voice of Michael Caine. Two sets of siblings, brought together by their dating parents, clash on a surprise holiday to the Cornwall coast. When they encounter a sand creature known as the Psammead, the children's lives are transformed as their new friend grants them one wish a day.

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Action adventure sequel starring Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Jon Voight and Helen Mirren. When a stranger informs them that one of their ancestors might have been involved in the plot to assassinate President Lincoln, treasure hunter Ben Gates and his archaeologist father Patrick set out to clear the family name. Their quest takes them to Buckingham Palace and the White House, where they uncover evidence of a lost city of gold.

programme.title: Paddington 2
programme.desc: Comedy starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins, Hugh Grant and Ben Whishaw as the voice of Paddington. When a rare pop-up book is stolen before Paddington can buy it as a birthday present for his aunt Lucy, the little bear is arrested as the prime suspect in the theft. While Paddington is attempting to make the most of his incarceration, the true thief is using clues hidden in the book to locate the immense fortune of its late author.

programme.title: Cats
programme.desc: A tribe of cats called the Jellicles must decide annually which one will ascend to the Heaviside Layer and come back to a new life. Co-writer and director Tom Hooper's adaptation of Andrew Lloyd Webber's hit 1981 musical, featuring classic tracks Memory and Mr Mistoffelees. Starring Judi Dench, James Corden, Idris Elba and Rebel Wilson.

programme.title: Proximity
programme.desc: A young scientist is abducted by extra-terrestrials, but when no one believes his story he becomes obsessed with finding proof, which leads him on a journey of discovery. Writer/director Eric Demeusy's sci-fi drama, starring Ryan Masson, Highdee Kuan and Christian Prentice.

programme.title: The Dark Crystal
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure. A thousand years have passed and a time of change has arrived. Raised by the gentle Mystics, Jen, a young Gelfling, has been chosen to go on a hazardous journey. He must find the shard to heal the magical Dark Crystal. If he fails, the evil Skeksis will rule the world forever.

programme.title: Four Kids and It
programme.desc: Fantasy drama starring Matthew Goode and Paula Patton, and featuring the voice of Michael Caine. Two sets of siblings, brought together by their dating parents, clash on a surprise holiday to the Cornwall coast. When they encounter a sand creature known as the Psammead, the children's lives are transformed as their new friend grants them one wish a day.

programme.title: Proximity
programme.desc: A young scientist is abducted by extra-terrestrials, but when no one believes his story he becomes obsessed with finding proof, which leads him on a journey of discovery. Writer/director Eric Demeusy's sci-fi drama, starring Ryan Masson, Highdee Kuan and Christian Prentice.

programme.title: Earth to Echo
programme.desc: Science-fiction adventure starring Teo Halm. After their mobile phones start receiving strange signals, three teenage friends are drawn into the desert where they make an astounding discovery.

programme.title: Homeward Bound: the Incredible Journey
programme.desc: Adventure remake of the 1963 animal tale, featuring the voices of Michael J Fox, Sally Field and Don Ameche. When Peter, Hope and Jamie have to move from their mountain home to the city for their stepfather's temporary teaching post, their pets - Chance, an American bulldog, Shadow, a golden retriever, and Sassy, a Himalayan cat - are left in the care of a family friend. When she goes away for a few days, the animals decide to go in search of their owners.\n.

programme.title: Penelope
programme.desc: Fantasy drama starring Christina Ricci and James McAvoy. Penelope's wealthy family suffers from a curse that caused her to be born with a pig snout. Her plight is made worse when she attracts the attention of a tenacious newspaper reporter.

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Fictional account of the evolution and creation of children's classic Peter Pan, starring Johnny Depp as Scottish playwright JM Barrie. In the early 1900s, Barrie's lacklustre career is reinvigorated when he befriends the four fatherless Llewelyn Davies boys and their recently widowed mother, Sylvia. As their relationship develops, the seeds are sown for Barrie's most famous work.

programme.title: Babe
programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring James Cromwell. Babe, an orphaned pig, is raised on a farm by the sheepdog Fly. Although he is destined for the dinner table, Babe astonishes Farmer Hoggett and his fellow farmyard animals when he shows talent as a 'sheep-pig'.

programme.title: Maleficent: Mistress of Evil
programme.desc: Aurora's impending marriage to Prince Phillip is cause for celebration in the kingdom of Ulstead and the neighbouring Moors, as the wedding serves to unite the two worlds. But Maleficent and her god-daughter begin to question the complex family ties that bind them as they are pulled in different directions. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Angelina Jolie and Elle Fanning, with Michelle Pfeiffer and Chiwetel Ejiofor.

programme.title: Earth to Echo
programme.desc: Science-fiction adventure starring Teo Halm. After their mobile phones start receiving strange signals, three teenage friends are drawn into the desert where they make an astounding discovery.

programme.title: Penelope
programme.desc: Fantasy drama starring Christina Ricci and James McAvoy. Penelope's wealthy family suffers from a curse that caused her to be born with a pig snout. Her plight is made worse when she attracts the attention of a tenacious newspaper reporter.

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Fictional account of the evolution and creation of children's classic Peter Pan, starring Johnny Depp as Scottish playwright JM Barrie. In the early 1900s, Barrie's lacklustre career is reinvigorated when he befriends the four fatherless Llewelyn Davies boys and their recently widowed mother, Sylvia. As their relationship develops, the seeds are sown for Barrie's most famous work.

programme.title: Homeward Bound: the Incredible Journey
programme.desc: Adventure remake of the 1963 animal tale, featuring the voices of Michael J Fox, Sally Field and Don Ameche. When Peter, Hope and Jamie have to move from their mountain home to the city for their stepfather's temporary teaching post, their pets - Chance, an American bulldog, Shadow, a golden retriever, and Sassy, a Himalayan cat - are left in the care of a family friend. When she goes away for a few days, the animals decide to go in search of their owners.\n.

programme.title: Mafia Inc
programme.desc: A family of tailors have been dressing the Paterno Mafia family for three generations. Vincent `Vince' Gamache seeks to impress the godfather by staging a big operation, leading to major repercussions. Director Daniel Grou's drama, starring Sergio Castellitto, Marc-Andre Grondin and Gilbert Sicotte.

programme.title: Human Capital
programme.desc: The lives of two families collide when their children begin a relationship that leads to a tragic accident. Director Marc Meyers' remake of the 2013 Italian drama, itself a screen adaptation of Stephen Amidon's novel of the same name. Starring Liev Schreiber, Maria Tomei, Peter Sarsgaard, Maya Hawke and Alex Wolff.

programme.title: Must See Movies 2021
programme.desc: A preview of films that will be hitting the silver screen in 2021.

programme.title: Roald Dahl's The Witches
programme.desc: In 1967, an orphaned boy goes to live with his grandmother, only to find himself the prey of diabolical witches disguised as glamorous women. Heading to a seaside hotel seems like a great way to escape, but in an unfortunate twist of fate, the world's Grand High Witch is gathering her coven at the same resort, and has a nefarious plan in store. Co-writer/director Robert Zemeckis's take on the beloved Roald Dahl fantasy, starring Anne Hathaway, Octavia Spencer, Stanley Tucci, and narrated by Chris Rock.

programme.title: Magic Arch
programme.desc: A young dolphin with an active imagination saves Fish Town from evil moray eels and reunites with his father after discovering a magic arch that makes wishes come true. Director Vasiliy Rovenskiy's animated fantasy, with the voices of Stephen Ochsner, Daniel Medvedev, Bruce Grant and David Grout.

A lowly utility worker is called to the future by a mysterious radio signal. He must leave his dying wife to embark on a journey that will force him to face his deepest fears in an attempt to change the fabric of reality and save humankind from its greatest environmental crisis yet. Sci-fi drama, starring Kodi Smit-McPhee and Ryan Kwanten.

programme.title: SAS: Red Notice
programme.desc: Off-duty SAS soldier Tom Buckingham attempts to thwart a terror attack on a train running through the Channel Tunnel. Despite being injured, Buckingham is the only chance of survival for the passengers. Action thriller based on the novel by Andy McNab, starring Sam Heughan, Ruby Rose, Andy Serkis, Hannah John-Kamen and Tom Hopper.

programme.title: The Glorias
programme.desc: The story of feminist icon Gloria Steinem's itinerant childhood and its influence on her life as a writer, activist and organiser for women's rights worldwide. Director Julie Taymor's biopic, starring Julianne Moore, Alicia Vikander, Ryan Kiera Armstrong and Lulu Wilson, who all portray Steinem at different points in her life. With Janelle Monae and Bette Midler.

programme.title: Target Number One
programme.desc: A former heroin addict gets involved in a drug deal in Thailand, but when the deal goes sour, he is thrown into prison and given a 100-year sentence. While he tries to survive his Bangkok incarceration, the news of his conviction captures the attention of Canadian Globe and Mail journalist Victor Malarek, who decides to go after the shady undercover cops responsible. Thriller based on a true story, starring Josh Hartnett and Antoine Olivier Pilon.

programme.title: Roald Dahl's The Witches
programme.desc: In 1967, an orphaned boy goes to live with his grandmother, only to find himself the prey of diabolical witches disguised as glamorous women. programme.title: Gutterbug
programme.desc: A young man embarks on a dark and dangerous path with his misfit crew when he decides to find his way back home to his family, three years after walking out on his 18th birthday. Drama from first-time director Andrew Gibson, starring Andrew Yackel, Justin Pietropaolo, Hannah Mosqueda and Paul Kandarian.

programme.title: Human Capital
programme.desc: The lives of two families collide when their children begin a relationship that leads to a tragic accident. Director Marc Meyers' remake of the 2013 Italian drama, itself a screen adaptation of Stephen Amidon's novel of the same name. Starring Liev Schreiber, Maria Tomei, Peter Sarsgaard, Maya Hawke and Alex Wolff.

programme.title: State of Mind
programme.desc: Dr Alan Stone is a psychiatrist charged with providing treatment to three paranoid schizophrenic patients at a Michigan hospital who all think they were Jesus Christ. Director Jon Avnet's drama based on Eric Nazarian's book The Three Christs of Ypsilanti, starring Richard Gere, Peter Dinklage and Bradley Whitford.

programme.title: Welcome to Sudden Death
programme.desc: A security guard and former member of the Special Forces brings his two kids to work at a basketball arena on the same day that the governor, mayor, thousands of other spectators and eight terrorists happen to be attending. Action thriller, starring Michael Jai White, Michael Eklund and Sabryn Rock.

While he tries to survive his Bangkok incarceration, the news of his conviction captures the attention of Canadian Globe and Mail journalist Victor Malarek, who decides to go after the shady undercover cops responsible. Thriller based on a true story, starring Josh Hartnett and Antoine Olivier Pilon.

A lowly utility worker is called to the future by a mysterious radio signal. He must leave his dying wife to embark on a journey that will force him to face his deepest fears in an attempt to change the fabric of reality and save humankind from its greatest environmental crisis yet. Sci-fi drama, starring Kodi Smit-McPhee and Ryan Kwanten.

programme.title: The Crow
programme.desc: Action fantasy starring Brandon Lee. Rock guitarist Eric Draven is murdered and his fiancée Shelly raped and left for dead by a gang sent to evict them from their apartment. A year later, Eric is brought back from the dead by a crow and seeks revenge.

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: Horror thriller starring Jennifer Love Hewitt and Sarah Michelle Gellar. When four teenagers are involved in a hit-and-run accident, they panic and dump the body. But several months later, when one of the group receives an anonymous letter from someone who knows details of the crime, it sets off a terrifying chain of events.

programme.title: Rabid
programme.desc: An aspiring fashion designer is transformed by an experimental stem cell treatment when she is disfigured in an accident - but her new life has dramatic consequences. Jen and Sylvia Soska's remake of the cult David Cronenberg chiller, starring Laura Vandervoort, Benjamin Hollingsworth and Ted Atherton.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: A look at all the films coming to Sky Cinema in March.

programme.title: In Fabric
programme.desc: Supernatural horror comedy starring Marianne Jean-Baptiste and Hayley Squires. Recently divorced Sheila is looking for a dress to impress, and happens upon a striking red gown that she quickly snaps up. When Sheila finds herself caught up in strange and increasingly dangerous events, though, the culprit may well be the mysterious, malevolent garment.

programme.title: Annabelle Comes Home
programme.desc: Demonologists Ed and Lorraine Warren welcome babysitter Mary Ellen to look after their daughter, Judy, while they investigate another case. However, it's not long before the Annabelle doll, the bane of their existence, starts to work its evil once more. Gary Dauberman's horror, the seventh instalment in the Conjuring Universe saga, starring Mckenna Grace, Madison Iseman and Katie Sarife.

programme.title: The Curse of La Llorona
programme.desc: In 1673 Mexico, a son gives his mother a necklace, with tragic repercussions. Three hundred years later in Los Angeles, a legendary ghost stalks local children at night, prompting naive social worker Anna Tate-Garcia and her kids to be drawn into the spirit's deadly wrath. Director Michael Chaves's horror set in The Conjuring universe, starring Linda Cardellini, Roman Christou and Jaynee-Lynne Kinchen.

programme.title: Men in Black: International
programme.desc: The intergalactic law enforcers have always protected the Earth from the scum of the universe. This time they tackle their biggest threat - a mole in the Men in Black organisation. Director F Gary Gray's fantasy sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Rebecca Ferguson.

programme.title: Butt Boy
programme.desc: Detective Russel B Fox is dragged into a mystery after his Alcoholics Anonymous sponsor Chip Gutchell becomes the main suspect in a missing child's investigation. Russel begins to suspect that Chip's addiction may not be to alcohol, but something much more sinister. Comedy, starring Tyler Rice, Shelby Dash, and Tyler Cornack, who also co-wrote and directed.

programme.title: The Wretched
programme.desc: While trying to cope with his parents' imminent divorce, a defiant teenage lad faces off with a thousand-year-old witch, who has taken over the body of the woman next door. Brett and Drew Pierce's horror, starring John-Paul Howard, Piper Curda, Jamison Jones, Azie Tesfai and Zarah Mahler.

programme.title: Annabelle Comes Home
programme.desc: Demonologists Ed and Lorraine Warren welcome babysitter Mary Ellen to look after their daughter, Judy, while they investigate another case. However, it's not long before the Annabelle doll, the bane of their existence, starts to work its evil once more. Gary Dauberman's horror, the seventh instalment in the Conjuring Universe saga, starring Mckenna Grace, Madison Iseman and Katie Sarife.

programme.title: Van Helsing
programme.desc: Action fantasy horror from the director of The Mummy, starring Hugh Jackman as Vatican-appointed monster-slayer Gabriel Van Helsing. Dispatched to 19th-century Transylvania to aid Gypsy princess Anna Valerious (Kate Beckinsale) in her long-running battle against Count Dracula, Van Helsing discovers that his vampire foe is using other legendary monsters in his evil work. With the Wolf Man already his slave, all Dracula needs to make him unstoppable is Frankenstein's Monster.

programme.title: Men in Black: International
programme.desc: The intergalactic law enforcers have always protected the Earth from the scum of the universe. This time they tackle their biggest threat - a mole in the Men in Black organisation. Director F Gary Gray's fantasy sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Rebecca Ferguson.

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: Science-fiction horror starring Laurence Fishburne and Sam Neill.\nThe year is 2047, and a rescue mission is sent to the outer reaches of our solar system to contact the Event Horizon, a prototype spaceship that has been missing for the last seven years. As the crew members search for survivors, they discover the terrifying secrets that lie within the mysterious spaceship.\n.

programme.title: The Curse of La Llorona
programme.desc: In 1673 Mexico, a son gives his mother a necklace, with tragic repercussions. Three hundred years later in Los Angeles, a legendary ghost stalks local children at night, prompting naive social worker Anna Tate-Garcia and her kids to be drawn into the spirit's deadly wrath. Director Michael Chaves's horror set in The Conjuring universe, starring Linda Cardellini, Roman Christou and Jaynee-Lynne Kinchen.

programme.title: Friday the 13th Part VII: the New Blood
programme.desc: A telepathic woman accidentally sets supernatural serial killer Jason free to kill again, and soon realises she must use her psychic powers to defeat the monster and save herself from a grisly fate. Horror sequel, with Lar Park Lincoln, Kevin Spirtas and Kane Hodder.

programme.title: In Fabric
programme.desc: Supernatural horror comedy starring Marianne Jean-Baptiste and Hayley Squires. Recently divorced Sheila is looking for a dress to impress, and happens upon a striking red gown that she quickly snaps up. When Sheila finds herself caught up in strange and increasingly dangerous events, though, the culprit may well be the mysterious, malevolent garment.

programme.title: Bicentennial Man
programme.desc: Science-fiction comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Embeth Davidtz and Sam Neill. The early 21st century: Andrew, a metallic android, is bought by Richard Martin to perform domestic tasks for his family. But faulty wiring results in Andrew developing emotions and creative talents. Over the next 200 years, he learns about the complexities - and the price - of becoming human.

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: Science-fiction thriller, a sequel to the 1979 blockbuster Alien, starring Sigourney Weaver. Having overcome a terrifying alien predator, Ripley has spent 57 years asleep, drifting through space in a life-pod. She is rescued, but discovers that the planet where the creature was originally found has been colonised. When contact with the planet is lost, Ripley and a platoon of marines are sent to investigate.

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic action thriller from director Steven Spielberg, based on the Philip K Dick short story, starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell and Samantha Morton. In the mid-21st century, John Anderton is in charge of the Justice Department's Precrime unit, an elite force that can predict offences and make arrests before the crimes are committed. But Anderton's life falls apart when he is labelled a future murderer and forced to go on the run to clear his name.

programme.title: Ad Astra
programme.desc: Three decades ago, Clifford McBride led a voyage into deep space, but the crew were never heard from again. Now his son, Roy, embarks on a daring mission to Neptune to uncover the truth about his missing father and a strange power surge that threatens the stability of the universe. Director James Gray's sci-fi drama, starring Brad Pitt, Tommy Lee Jones and Ruth Negga.

programme.title: Van Helsing
programme.desc: Action fantasy horror from the director of The Mummy, starring Hugh Jackman as Vatican-appointed monster-slayer Gabriel Van Helsing. Dispatched to 19th-century Transylvania to aid Gypsy princess Anna Valerious (Kate Beckinsale) in her long-running battle against Count Dracula, Van Helsing discovers that his vampire foe is using other legendary monsters in his evil work. With the Wolf Man already his slave, all Dracula needs to make him unstoppable is Frankenstein's Monster.

programme.title: Bicentennial Man
programme.desc: Science-fiction comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Embeth Davidtz and Sam Neill. Over the next 200 years, he learns about the complexities - and the price - of becoming human.

Now his son, Roy, embarks on a daring mission to Neptune to uncover the truth about his missing father and a strange power surge that threatens the stability of the universe. Director James Gray's sci-fi drama, starring Brad Pitt, Tommy Lee Jones and Ruth Negga.

programme.title: Big Trouble in Little China
programme.desc: Action adventure starring Kurt Russell as tough truck driver Jack Burton, who's drawn into a supernatural world beneath San Francisco's Chinatown when he attempts to rescue his best friend's fiancée from the clutches of an evil magician.

programme.title: Play or Die
programme.desc: Two passionate gamers indulge in 'Paranoia', a terrifying escape game in an abandoned psychiatric hospital. At the location of the finale, lost in a frightening forest, four other participants are waiting on them - and they soon realise that only one of them will get out of there alive. Horror, starring Charley Palmer Rothwell, Roxane Mesquida and Marie Zabukovec.

programme.title: Ocean's Thirteen
programme.desc: Crime comedy caper sequel starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon and Al Pacino. When legendary Las Vegas entrepreneur Reuben Tishkoff is cheated out of his latest casino venture by dishonest partner Willy Bank, Tishkoff's friend Danny Ocean assembles his old crew for a spot of revenge.

programme.title: Looper
programme.desc: Sci-fi action thriller starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Bruce Willis. In the year 2074, when the Mob wants to get rid of someone, the target is sent 30 years into the past where hitmen like Joe are waiting to execute the contract and dispose of the body. It's a lucrative business for Joe but when he runs into his older self, he realises his employers want to close the loop for good.

programme.title: Underwater
programme.desc: Nora Price is a mechanical engineer at the Kepler drilling station, seven miles beneath the surface of the Pacific Ocean. She and a small crew fight for survival after a tremor causes catastrophic failures to the base's integrity. Meanwhile, in the inky void, something unspeakable lurks, waiting to attack. Sci-fi thriller, starring Kristen Stewart, Mamoudou Athie and Vincent Cassell.

programme.title: SAS Red Notice Special
programme.desc: A preview of the film.

programme.title: Hot Fuzz
programme.desc: Action comedy starring Simon Pegg and Nick Frost. London policeman Nicholas Angel is reassigned to a sleepy rural village, but soon finds that the big city doesn't have a monopoly on crime.

programme.title: Abduction
programme.desc: A man steps out of a fountain in a park in Ho Chi Minh City with no memory of who he is. He wanders the city trying to piece together his past while being relentlessly pursued by mysterious and dangerous figures. Action horror, starring Scott Adkins, Andy On and Truong Ngoc Anh.

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: Looper
programme.desc: Sci-fi action thriller starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Bruce Willis. In the year 2074, when the Mob wants to get rid of someone, the target is sent 30 years into the past where hitmen like Joe are waiting to execute the contract and dispose of the body. It's a lucrative business for Joe but when he runs into his older self, he realises his employers want to close the loop for good.

programme.title: Hot Fuzz
programme.desc: Action comedy starring Simon Pegg and Nick Frost. London policeman Nicholas Angel is reassigned to a sleepy rural village, but soon finds that the big city doesn't have a monopoly on crime.

programme.title: Crank
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Jason Statham. Hitman Chev Chelios is injected with a poison that will kill him if his adrenaline level drops, so he swiftly embarks on a heart-pumping mission of revenge.

programme.title: 10 Minutes Gone
programme.desc: A man suffers amnesia during a bank heist gone wrong, and must find a way to remember who sabotaged him while he's being hunted down. Action mystery, starring Bruce Willis and Michael Chiklis.

programme.title: Abduction
programme.desc: A man steps out of a fountain in a park in Ho Chi Minh City with no memory of who he is. He wanders the city trying to piece together his past while being relentlessly pursued by mysterious and dangerous figures. Action horror, starring Scott Adkins, Andy On and Truong Ngoc Anh.

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Jason Statham and Shu Qi. Frank Martin is a professional driver who moves goods around for shady clients with no questions asked. When his latest cargo turns out to be a beautiful Asian woman, Martin is forced to break his own code and go on the run from his ruthless employers.\n.

programme.title: Black and Blue
programme.desc: A rookie cop finds herself targeted by corrupt police and gangsters when she witnesses a drug dealer's murder. She teams up with the one person from her community who is willing to help her, as she tries to escape both the criminals out for revenge and the police who are desperate to destroy the incriminating evidence. Crime drama, starring Naomie Harris, Tyrese Gibson and Frank Grillo.

programme.title: The World's End
programme.desc: Sci-fi comedy starring Simon Pegg and Nick Frost. Five old school friends reunite for an epic pub crawl in their home town and unwittingly become mankind's only hope for survival.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Bruce Willis and Alan Rickman. New York cop John McClane gets caught up in a terrorist plot after arriving in Los Angeles to spend Christmas with his estranged wife Holly and his two children. When Holly is taken hostage in the offices of the Japanese corporation she works for, McClane launches a daring rescue attempt.

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: Comedy caper starring Michael Caine and Noël Coward. When Charlie Croker is released from prison, he is soon up to no good. After securing the financial backing of crimelord Mr Bridger, he puts into motion plans for a gold-bullion robbery that is to take place in Turin. But the Mafia has other ideas...

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: Crime thriller based on the 1969 British caper movie, starring Mark Wahlberg and Edward Norton. A criminal gang run by Charlie Croker (Wahlberg) and veteran thief John Bridger (Donald Sutherland) pulls off an audacious gold bullion robbery in Venice, only for colleague Steve (Edward Norton) to run off with the loot, leaving Bridger dead. Finally tracking Steve down to LA, Croker enlists the help of Bridger's safecracking daughter Stella (Charlize Theron) to get even in spectacular fashion.

programme.title: Black and Blue
programme.desc: A rookie cop finds herself targeted by corrupt police and gangsters when she witnesses a drug dealer's murder. She teams up with the one person from her community who is willing to help her, as she tries to escape both the criminals out for revenge and the police who are desperate to destroy the incriminating evidence. Crime drama, starring Naomie Harris, Tyrese Gibson and Frank Grillo.

programme.title: The World's End
programme.desc: Sci-fi comedy starring Simon Pegg and Nick Frost. Five old school friends reunite for an epic pub crawl in their home town and unwittingly become mankind's only hope for survival.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Bruce Willis and Alan Rickman. New York cop John McClane gets caught up in a terrorist plot after arriving in Los Angeles to spend Christmas with his estranged wife Holly and his two children. When Holly is taken hostage in the offices of the Japanese corporation she works for, McClane launches a daring rescue attempt.

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Drama starring Whoopi Goldberg and Danny Glover. Georgia, 1909: Celie, a teenage mother parted from her children, is married off to a brutal widower, Albert Johnson. A life of servitude and maltreatment begins, but Celie's spirit remains indomitable.

programme.title: Spartacus
programme.desc: Historical epic starring Kirk Douglas, Laurence Olivier and Tony Curtis. Born into slavery, the gladiator Spartacus longs for freedom and soon finds himself at the head of an army of slaves in revolt against the might of the Romans.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: Classic John Ford western starring John Wayne and Maureen O'Hara. On the Mexican border in the 1880s, Lieutenant Colonel Yorke of the US cavalry is conducting a lonely, vain campaign against marauding Apaches. When his trooper son arrives at the fort, followed by Yorke's estranged wife, family conflict adds to his troubles.

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: Science-fiction action thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. A rescue mission deep in the Central American jungle turns into a fight for survival as a crack commando unit, led by Major 'Dutch' Schaeffer, comes up against an unseen enemy - a predator able to resist the most up-to-date weaponry and kill with relentless efficiency.

programme.title: Dangerous Minds
programme.desc: Classroom drama based on a true story, starring Michelle Pfeiffer and George Dzundza. A female ex-marine teaching at a tough inner-city school is determined to see her pupils make progress, but must struggle against the odds to win the hearts and minds of her disaffected class.

programme.title: The Wrestler
programme.desc: Sports drama starring Mickey Rourke. Former champion wrestler Randy 'The Ram' Robinson is reduced to supermarket work and small-time weekend bouts to pay his bills. So when he ends up in hospital after an emergency heart bypass operation, it looks as though he must throw in the towel.

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
programme.desc: A tough, embittered US marine sergeant sets out to mould a group of raw recruits into men fit for action against the Japanese in the Pacific during the Second World War. Although his training methods are often brutal, his controversial approach looks set to pay dividends when they finally see real combat. Adventure, starring John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara and Forrest Tucker.

programme.title: It's a Wonderful Life
programme.desc: Frank Capra's classic fantasy drama, starring James Stewart, Donna Reed and Lionel Barrymore. George Bailey is a small-town businessman who believes he has been a failure. Contemplating suicide, George meets his guardian angel and discovers what life in his home town of Bedford Falls would have been like had he never lived.

programme.title: Dangerous Minds
programme.desc: Classroom drama based on a true story, starring Michelle Pfeiffer and George Dzundza. A female ex-marine teaching at a tough inner-city school is determined to see her pupils make progress, but must struggle against the odds to win the hearts and minds of her disaffected class.

programme.title: The Wrestler
programme.desc: Sports drama starring Mickey Rourke. Former champion wrestler Randy 'The Ram' Robinson is reduced to supermarket work and small-time weekend bouts to pay his bills. Although his training methods are often brutal, his controversial approach looks set to pay dividends when they finally see real combat. Adventure, starring John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara and Forrest Tucker.

programme.title: It's a Wonderful Life
programme.desc: Frank Capra's classic fantasy drama, starring James Stewart, Donna Reed and Lionel Barrymore. George Bailey is a small-town businessman who believes he has been a failure. Contemplating suicide, George meets his guardian angel and discovers what life in his home town of Bedford Falls would have been like had he never lived.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: Oscar-winning drama, based on the novel by James Jones, starring Burt Lancaster, Deborah Kerr, Montgomery Clift and Frank Sinatra. When private Robert E Lee Prewitt transfers to Schofield Barracks, Pearl Harbor, his new commander offers him the longed-for post of bugler if he will box for the company. But Prewitt refuses, having once blinded his best friend in the ring, and a battle of wills begins that will come to affect the lives of many around them.

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical biographical drama starring Joaquin Phoenix and Reese Witherspoon. John R Cash emerges from humble farm beginnings to become country-and-western legend Johnny Cash. But the road to stardom for the 'Man in Black' is not without hardship and heartbreak, although salvation appears in his dependable soulmate, June Carter.\n.

programme.title: Blade Runner
programme.desc: Futuristic thriller starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer and Sean Young. Los Angeles in the year 2019: police learn that four lethal androids have escaped from a space colony to find their creator on Earth. Former cop Rick Deckard, an expert in distinguishing humans from 'replicants', is assigned to track the androids down.

programme.title: Behind the Candelabra
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Michael Douglas and Matt Damon. Flamboyant pianist Liberace is already one of the most famous entertainers in the world when he meets young Scott Thorson in 1977. Scott is at first seduced and then overpowered by the larger-than-life character and his opulent lifestyle. But their six-year relationship is volatile and kept secret from Liberace's adoring fans.

programme.title: Annie
programme.desc: Musical adapted from the popular stage show, starring Albert Finney and Carol Burnett. In Depression-era America, ten-year-old orphan Annie shuts out her unhappy life with dreams of 'tomorrow'. Then her luck changes when she is temporarily adopted by billionaire Daddy Warbucks.

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring John Wayne and Maureen O'Hara. Sean Thornton returns to his native Galway to settle down in peace after growing up in America. The quiet life still eludes him, however, as he finds himself reluctantly sparring with his neighbours, his sweetheart and his conscience.

programme.title: Sunset Blvd
programme.desc: Drama starring William Holden, Gloria Swanson and Erich von Stroheim. Screenwriter Joe Gillis floats dead in the swimming pool of a neglected Hollywood mansion. Six months earlier, out of work and desperate, he'd been hired as a writer by former silent screen star Norma Desmond, who was hoping to make a triumphant comeback.

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical biographical drama starring Joaquin Phoenix and Reese Witherspoon. John R Cash emerges from humble farm beginnings to become country-and-western legend Johnny Cash. But the road to stardom for the 'Man in Black' is not without hardship and heartbreak, although salvation appears in his dependable soulmate, June Carter.\n.

programme.title: Blade Runner
programme.desc: Futuristic thriller starring Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer and Sean Young. Los Angeles in the year 2019: police learn that four lethal androids have escaped from a space colony to find their creator on Earth. Former cop Rick Deckard, an expert in distinguishing humans from 'replicants', is assigned to track the androids down.

programme.title: Behind the Candelabra
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Michael Douglas and Matt Damon. Flamboyant pianist Liberace is already one of the most famous entertainers in the world when he meets young Scott Thorson in 1977. Scott is at first seduced and then overpowered by the larger-than-life character and his opulent lifestyle. But their six-year relationship is volatile and kept secret from Liberace's adoring fans.

programme.title: The Goldfinch
programme.desc: A boy in New York is taken in by a rich Upper East Side family after his mother is killed in a bombing at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Director John Crowley's drama based on the Donna Tartt novel, starring Ansel Elgort, Nicole Kidman and Jeffrey Wright.

programme.title: Miss Juneteenth
programme.desc: Turquoise Jones is a single mother who saves every penny working at the local bar and funeral home. She hopes her 15-year-old daughter, Kai, will repeat her glory days at this year's Miss Juneteenth beauty pageant. Writer/director Channing Godfrey Peoples's drama, starring Nicole Beharie, Kendrick Sampson and Alexis Chikaeze.

programme.title: Misbehaviour
programme.desc: It's 1970, and Bob Hope is due to host the Miss World beauty pageant in London, one of the most watched shows in the world. However, the organisers, and the Hollywood star, do not count on the newly formed women's liberation movement, who plan to disrupt the controversial ceremony. Director Philippa Lowthorpe's comedy drama, starring Keira Knightley, Gugu Mbatha-Raw and Jessie Buckley.

programme.title: Eighth Grade
programme.desc: Introverted 13-year-old Kayla Day is finishing her final week at a New York public school. She posts motivational online videos on about confidence and self-image that get few views, Meanwhile, Mark, her single father, struggles to connect with her and break Kayla's reliance on social media. Writer/director Bo Burnham's critically acclaimed comedy drama, starring Elsie Fisher, Josh Hamilton and Emily Robinson.

programme.title: Knowing
programme.desc: Disaster thriller starring Nicolas Cage and Rose Byrne. When the opening of a time capsule at his son's school reveals a sheet of apparently random numbers, John Koestler soon realises the list is an encoded prediction of every global disaster of the past 50 years - plus three catastrophes that are yet to occur. Can he convince anyone else of the importance of his discovery before it's too late?

programme.title: Dolittle
programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring Robert Downey Jr. In 19th-century England, Dr John Dolittle lives with exotic animals as his only company. But when Queen Victoria falls ill, he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to find a cure, with help from his four-legged friends.

programme.title: Salt
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Angelina Jolie as a highly respected CIA officer forced on the run when she is accused of being a Russian sleeper agent. She must employ all the skills she has learned on the job to keep one step ahead and prove her innocence.

programme.title: Never Rarely Sometimes Always
programme.desc: Upon discovering she is 10 weeks pregnant, 17-year-old Pennsylvanian Autumn Callahan wants a termination. When her own attempts fail, she confides in her cousin, Skylar, and they head for New York City with stolen cash. However, it transpires that Autumn has been given false information about her condition, and as the money runs out, things become even more desperate. Writer/director Eliza Hittman's drama, starring Sidney Flanigan, Talia Ryder and Theodore Pellerin.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: In 1927, Buckingham Palace informs Robert and Cora Crawley, the Earl and Countess of Grantham, that King George V and Queen Mary will visit Downton Abbey during a royal tour through Yorkshire. Director Michael Engler's drama based on the TV series, starring Hugh Bonneville, Michelle Dockery and Maggie Smith.

programme.title: Dolittle
programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring Robert Downey Jr. In 19th-century England, Dr John Dolittle lives with exotic animals as his only company. But when Queen Victoria falls ill, he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to find a cure, with help from his four-legged friends.

Writer/director Bo Burnham's critically acclaimed comedy drama, starring Elsie Fisher, Josh Hamilton and Emily Robinson.

programme.desc: In 1927, Buckingham Palace informs Robert and Cora Crawley, the Earl and Countess of Grantham, that King George V and Queen Mary will visit Downton Abbey during a royal tour through Yorkshire. Director Michael Engler's drama based on the TV series, starring Hugh Bonneville, Michelle Dockery and Maggie Smith.

programme.title: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: When a young girl is sent to live with her uncle on his remote country estate after her parents die, she discovers a magical garden. Director Marc Munden's adaptation of the classic Frances Hodgson Burnett tale, starring Colin Firth, Julie Walters and Dixie Egerickx.

programme.title: Lego DC Comics Super Heroes: Justice League vs Bizarro League
programme.desc: Animated action-adventure, with the voices of Diedrich Bader and Nolan North. Superman and the Justice League team up with their Bizarro League counterparts to thwart Darkseid's attempt to conquer the galaxy.

programme.title: The High Note
programme.desc: A superstar singer and her overworked personal assistant in Los Angeles are presented with a choice that could alter the course of their respective careers, as well as changing their lives for ever. Romantic drama, starring Dakota Johnson, Tracee Ellis Ross and Kelvin Harrison Jnr.

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic, a blue hedgehog who can run at supersonic speeds, is transported to Earth. A decade later, while enjoying life in Montana, his speedy skills create an electromagnetic pulse. Scientific genius Dr Robotnik is hired to investigate, and becomes obessed with capturing the creature for his power. Live action fantasy adventure based on the video games, starring James Marsden and Jim Carrey, with the voice of Ben Schwartz.

programme.title: Twist
programme.desc: In modern-day London, Oliver Twist is a talented graffiti artist who is lured into a street gang headed by Fagin. Before long, he and his hustlers plan the heist of the century. Director Martin Owen's update to Charles Dickens' Oliver Twist, starring Michael Caine, Lena Headey, Noel Clarke, and Sally Collett, who also wrote the screenplay.

programme.title: Like a Boss
programme.desc: Friends Mia and Mel run their own beauty company. However, things take a turn for the worse when their business runs into a massive amount of debt. They are forced to turn to ruthless benefactor Claire Luna, head of a major cosmetics empire, who intends to steal the business from under them. Comedy, starring Tiffany Haddish, Rose Byrne and Salma Hayek.

programme.title: The Players Championship Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the second day's play of the tournament, taking place at TPC Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida. Australian golfer Greg Norman holds the record for best score at this competition, a record he has held since 1994. He finished with a score of 24-under-par, finishing four strokes clear of nearest challenger Fuzzy Zoeller. No other player in the competition's history has ever finished with a score of 20-under-par or more.

programme.desc: The detective suspects the ambitious inventor of an electric vehicle murdered an associate who he believed stood in the way of his plans to compete head-on with motor vehicle industrialist Henry Ford. Crime drama, starring Yannick Bisson.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Part one of two. While investigating the abduction of a shy, churchgoing librarian, the detective is stunned to discover his former lover Anna working at the same library under an alias. Crime drama, starring Yannick Bisson, with Lisa Faulkner.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Part two of two. Having saved Anna from the Black Hand assassin, Murdoch meets Falcone and makes a deal to ensure her safety. Crime drama, guest starring Lisa Faulkner, with Yannick Bisson.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Flambeau enlists Fr Brown's help to steal the Queen's coronation gift from the Pope. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown

programme.title: Father Brown

programme.desc: The people of Saint Marie go into mourning when Dezzie Dixon, the island's favourite radio presenter, is murdered live on air and Jack must unravel a challenging mystery to find the culprit. Richard Blackwood guest stars in the whodunit, with Ardal O'Hanlon and Aude Legastelois.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. It appears to be a morbid practical joke, but proves shockingly accurate. Puzzled by the mystery, and with more suspects than he can shake a stick at, Inspector Craddock quickly enlists Miss Marple's help in solving the crime. Joan Hickson stars.

Second World War drama, starring Garret Dillahunt, Tom Felton and Jake Abel.

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed.

programme.title: Jesse Stone: No Remorse
programme.desc: The chief of police has been suspended from the force, and finds it harder than ever to control his drinking problem as a result. His old friend Captain Healy offers salvation by asking him to come to Boston and help solve a series of murders, but the investigation leads to a confrontation with the city's most dangerous crime boss. Detective thriller, starring Tom Selleck and Kathy Baker.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A chief accountant is found murdered just as the New York store where he worked is about to be sold to a museum of cultural history. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury, with Peter Donat and Kate Mulgrew.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica investigates when Seth disappears without trace, and discovers a link to a 20-year-old crime. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury as a crime writer with a mystery-solving sideline.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits an old friend who runs a haulage company, but finds herself having to prove his son innocent of murder while coming up against a gang of hijackers. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The absentee father of a gifted pianist is accused of killing the music teacher who acted as tutor and guardian to his daughter. A web of intrigue emerges when it becomes clear the dead man was planning to marry his pupil, but Jessica remains convinced that the police may not have arrested the right man for the crime. Angela Lansbury stars.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A travelling circus brings burglary and murder to Cabot Cove. Meanwhile, Sheriff Mort Metzger suffers painful memories when he sees a former girlfriend who left him for another man. Starring Angela Lansbury.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits the zoo to research her latest novel, where a venomous snake kills an animal rights activist. Mystified as to how the black mamba could escape, the amateur sleuth tries to discover whether there was a human hand behind the incident. Angela Lansbury stars.

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica attends a writers' seminar in Amsterdam and ends up investigating the disappearance of an old friend, suspected to have been kidnapped. Starring Angela Lansbury.
